title: Should Christians REALLY be Doing This as an Act of Faith?
description:
Mark 16:17‚Äì18 says believers ‚Äúwill pick up snakes with their hands, and when they drink deadly poison, it will not hurt them.‚Äù Some churches have taken this literally, and sadly, people have lost their lives because of it.

This passage was never meant as a command for Christians to prove their faith. It described miraculous signs that confirmed the message of the early apostles as they spread the gospel. 

God calls us to trust Him, not to put ourselves in harm‚Äôs way with deadly and dangerous acts.

Real faith is not about risking your life to prove to God that you believe. It's about having confidence in who Jesus is and what He has done. 

I'd love to hear your thoughts on this. Click here to watch the full video on my YouTube channel, The Beat: https://youtu.be/zNlgUOi8jU0

title: Were Old Testament Sexual Laws Harsh?
description:
Why did God give laws about virginity in the Old Testament?

To many, these laws may seem harsh or outdated, but they were actually given to protect women in a culture where their value and future were often tied to marriage.

God wasn‚Äôt endorsing patriarchy. He was setting boundaries that would guard women from being treated like property and from the pain of being discarded or dishonored.

It was about preserving dignity and honoring covenant, not controlling people.

Behind every law is the heart of a loving God who desires to protect what is sacred, including sexuality.

#biblestudy #oldtestament #biblicaltruth #christianliving #biblehistory #faithandculture #godsword #scripturetruth #biblecontext #christianteaching #biblestudytools #biblefacts

title: Here's Why Christian's Need to BEWARE of Taylor Swift
description:
A lot of us don‚Äôt realize just how powerful music really is. The words we sing, the messages we absorb ‚Äî they don‚Äôt just stay in our ears. They work their way into our hearts and shape the way we think, feel, and live.
‚†Ä
As Christians, we‚Äôre called to guard our hearts. That includes being mindful of what we listen to, and what we let our children listen to.
‚†Ä
This isn‚Äôt about calling out Taylor Swift. She seems like a kind and talented person. But when we look at the themes and messages in popular music ‚Äî hers included ‚Äî we have to ask ourselves: Does this honor God? Does it help me grow in holiness? Does it align with truth?
‚†Ä
Music isn‚Äôt neutral. It has a message. And over time, that message forms a mindset.
‚†Ä
Let‚Äôs be intentional. Let‚Äôs be discerning. And let‚Äôs talk about it.

Drop your thoughts below ‚Äî I‚Äôd love to hear from you.

title: Here‚Äôs Why Catholic Teaching Isn‚Äôt Biblical
description:
If you were raised Catholic, I want to speak to you from the heart. This may be difficult to hear, especially when your beliefs are deeply tied to family, tradition, and identity. But I invite you to consider this from a place of love and truth.

One of the key differences between Catholic and Protestant teaching is the inclusion of the Apocrypha‚Äîa collection of books found in Catholic Bibles but not in the original Hebrew Scriptures or most Protestant Bibles. These books, like Tobit, Judith, and 1 & 2 Maccabees, were written between the Old and New Testaments. While they contain historical and moral insights, they were never considered inspired Scripture by the Jewish people, by Jesus, or by the apostles.

In fact, it wasn‚Äôt until the Council of Trent in 1546 (over 1,500 years after Christ) that the Roman Catholic Church officially declared the Apocrypha as part of the biblical canon. That decision came in response to the Protestant Reformation, where leaders like Martin Luther urged a return to Scripture alone (sola scriptura).

We must be careful not to treat something as God‚Äôs Word if it was never affirmed by Christ or the early church. I know that may feel like a big shift. 

As always, I‚Äôm here if you ever have questions. We‚Äôre all on a journey of learning and growing in the truth. Let‚Äôs talk in the comments. 

#ChristianShorts #BibleTeaching #ApocryphaExplained #FalseTeachingExposed #BibleStudyTips #TheBeatWithAllenParr #BiblicalTruth #WhatTheBibleSays #ChristianContent #AllenParrShorts #BibleCanon #SolaScriptura

title: Does God Choose Who Goes to Heaven or Hell? The UNCOMFORTABLE Truth
description:
This is one of the most difficult questions Christians wrestle with ‚Äî the topic of predestination.

Some say‚Ä¶

If Jesus died on the cross to offer us free will, then how could God predestine some and not others?

And if God is loving and doesn‚Äôt want anyone to be separated from Him, how could He predestine anyone to hell?

It seems contradictory, and I get it. This is hard to process.

But the truth is‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs both.

Predestination and free will can exist. It‚Äôs one of those divine mysteries we may never fully understand on this side of heaven.

And that‚Äôs okay.

As Scripture says:
‚ÄúMy thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways... As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways.‚Äù‚Äî Isaiah 55:8-9

If you want a deeper, more thorough explanation to help you understand this complex topic, click the link in my bio to watch the full video released today. It‚Äôs one you won‚Äôt want to miss.

title: Does God Choose Who Goes To Heaven And Hell?
description:
Does God Choose Who Goes to Heaven or Hell? | Romans 9 Explained

This might be the most difficult and controversial chapter in the entire Bible.

Romans 9 raises powerful questions:

If God chooses who gets saved‚Ä¶ does that mean He chooses who goes to hell?

Is God unfair for showing mercy to some but not to others?

Do we even have free will if God is sovereign?

In this video, we take a deep dive into the five illustrations Paul uses to unpack these questions ‚Äî from Isaac and Ishmael to the Potter and the Clay. Whether you‚Äôve wrestled with God‚Äôs sovereignty, election, or the fairness of salvation, this teaching will challenge and encourage you.

We don‚Äôt shy away from the hard truths ‚Äî but we also leave room for mystery.

title: Debunking Pro Choice Arguments
description:

I say this with love: don‚Äôt let the world convince you that ending life is the answer. God‚Äôs path is hard sometimes, but it‚Äôs always right.

title: This is Who The Antichrist Is & What He Will Do
description:
The Bible gives us clear signs about the Antichrist.

He will perform false miracles, speak against God, stage a counterfeit resurrection, rise to global influence, and require a mark to buy or sell as a sign of loyalty to him (2 Thess. 2:9‚Äì10; Rev. 13:16‚Äì17).

This level of deception isn‚Äôt driven by human effort. Scripture says it will be empowered directly by Satan (2 Thess. 2:9).

We don‚Äôt know the day or hour when the Antichrist will appear. But as we live in the last days, it‚Äôs essential that we understand what God‚Äôs Word actually says. Knowing Scripture protects us from being misled, whether by speculation about world leaders or by the Antichrist himself when he is revealed.

Stay rooted in truth. Your discernment begins with God‚Äôs Word.

title: What Really Happens When We Die According To The Bible?
description:
What happens the moment a believer dies? Do we rest in the grave, or enter the presence of God?

Paul wrote, ‚ÄúTo be absent from the body is to be present with the Lord‚Äù (2 Cor. 5:8). Jesus told the thief on the cross, ‚ÄúToday you will be with Me in paradise‚Äù (Luke 23:43).

The Bible shows that believers are immediately with the Lord, fully alive in His presence.

If you‚Äôve ever feared the idea of death being a dark or empty place, Scripture brings clarity. For those who are in Christ, death is not silence or nothingness, it‚Äôs immediate, conscious presence with the Lord.

description:

But here‚Äôs the good news, Jesus came to destroy the works of the devil (1 John 3:8), and greater is He who is in you than he who is in the world (1 John 4:4).

So what do we do?

When thoughts come into your mind that are not of God, take them captive just like Paul taught:
‚ÄúWe take every thought captive to make it obedient to Christ.‚Äù ‚Äî 2 Corinthians 10:5

Pray. Surrender those thoughts to God. Trust that He is protecting you.
If you've given your life to Christ you are a child of God, and the enemy has no dominion over God's children.

title: What Jesus Taught Us About Forgiving Our Enemies
description:
‚ÄúFather, forgive them, for they know not what they do.‚Äù (Luke 23:34)

These were among Jesus‚Äô first words on the cross. He was in physical agony, surrounded by people who mocked and rejected Him, yet He prayed for forgiveness.

Jesus was fulfilling the very mission He came for: to seek and save the lost. Even in His suffering, He acted as our intercessor.

This moment reveals the depth of God‚Äôs mercy. It reminds us that no one is beyond the reach of grace, not even those who nailed Him to the cross.

The same mercy Jesus extended then is available now. No matter your past, you can be made new.  üôèüèΩ

title: He Had Minutes Left to Live‚Ä¶ and Jesus Said This.
description:
‚ÄúTruly I say to you, today you will be with me in paradise.‚Äù (Luke 23:43)

Jesus said these words to a dying criminal. A man who had no chance to fix his past. No time to earn anything. All he did was believe... and that was enough.

Imagine hanging on a cross, moments from death, and hearing the Son of God promise you eternity. Not later. Not someday. Today.

This is the power of grace. It‚Äôs never too late to turn to Jesus. The thief asked for mercy, and Jesus gave him a place in paradise.

It was a declaration that salvation is by faith alone.

If you've been waiting to clean yourself up before coming to Christ, stop waiting because tomorrow isn't guaranteed. Surrender your life to Him today.

If you know someone who doesn't know Christ, please share this with them.

title: God Will Judge The World In These Five End Times Prophecy Judgments! Edited
description:
Did you know the Bible teaches that there will be five end-time judgments?

Unfortunately, many Christians have not been taught about these judgments or why they are important. Understanding them can shape how we live, serve, and prepare to stand before God.

In this video, I discuss two of these judgments:

1. The Sheep and Goat Judgment ‚Äì This is where Christ separates those who truly followed Him from those who only claimed to. (Matthew 25:31‚Äì46)
2. The Bema Seat Judgment ‚Äì In this judgment, believers are not judged for salvation, but for how faithfully they lived after being saved. (2 Corinthians 5:10, 1 Corinthians 3:12‚Äì15, Romans 14:10‚Äì12)

These are not metaphors or symbols; they are real events that are coming.

title: Here‚Äôs Why the Hyper Charismatic Movement Is SO Dangerous
description:
The hyper-charismatic movement is spreading fast, and it‚Äôs hurting a lot of people.

Many churches today are caught in the hyper-charismatic wave, where emotional experiences, instant healing, and deliverance are prioritized over sound doctrine.

But this is not how Jesus ministered or healed people; it's nowhere found in the Bible. 

This movement has roots in emotionalism and unbiblical practices that pull people away from truth.

If you're in a church like this, I know it‚Äôs hard, but it may be time to step away.
Look out for red flags like forced manifestations, pressure to speak in tongues, and elevating pastors above Scripture.

title: 5 Types of Clothing Christian Women NEED to Stop Wearing!
description:
This is a topic I've been wanting to address for a while now. 

Today's fashion is all about comfort and style. I get it. But as followers of Christ, we have to ask ourselves: Does what we wear reflect God‚Äôs heart for us and for others? 

In 1 Timothy 2:9-10, Paul reminds us that we are called to dress modestly, with decency and respect. 

This doesn‚Äôt mean we have to wear unflattering clothing. Modesty doesn‚Äôt mean we can‚Äôt look good, but it does mean we must be aware of the deeper impact of our choices. Our clothes (this goes for men too) should not distract our brothers and sisters in Christ by tempting them to sin. 

So, let‚Äôs be intentional. Let‚Äôs dress in a way that honors God.

What are your thoughts on modesty as a Christian?

title: They Used to Sing About Jesus. Now They Reject Him Completely!
description:
I remember searching for one of my favorite worship songs by Audrey Assad, but instead of a song, I found a video where she shared that she had turned away from her faith. My heart sank. How can someone create such beautiful music worshiping God and then walk away from Him?

She‚Äôs not the only one. Marty Sampson and others have also left Christianity, and it raises an important question: Why is this happening?

This is why apologetics matters. It‚Äôs not just about defending our faith, it‚Äôs about understanding it deeply and helping others do the same. As believers, we aren‚Äôt called to condemn those who walk away but to pray for them and equip ourselves to answer the hard questions that might someone doubt their faith.

If you want to grow stronger in your faith and be equipped to help others navigate their toughest questions, I encourage you to watch my free masterclass, How to Defend Your Faith with Dr. Frank Turek | Apologetics 101, on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/live/anH0396d7g4?si=klMjX917zPv9FFcF

title: The 4 Mysterious Women of Revelation EXPLAINED!
description:
Did you know Revelation describes four key symbolic women, each revealing a powerful spiritual truth? While other women are mentioned, these four stand out for their prophetic significance:

‚Üí Jezebel (Revelation 2:20) represents spiritual corruption within the Church, leading believers into idolatry and sexual immorality.

‚Üí The Woman Clothed with the Sun (Revelation 12) symbolizes Israel and God‚Äôs redemptive plan.

‚Üí The Great Harlot (Revelation 17), one of the most controversial figures, represents false religion and worldly seduction.

‚Üí Finally, The Bride of Christ (Revelation 19) is the true Church, made pure and ready for Christ‚Äôs return.

Each of these figures carries a powerful message about faith, deception, and God‚Äôs ultimate plan.

title: How do you defend the Bible against skeptics?
description:

Ever had someone hit you with questions like:

‚Üí  ‚ÄúHow can you be sure the Bible wasn‚Äôt just made up by people?‚Äù

title: Many Christians Reject This Teaching on Tithing‚ÄîBut It's Biblical
description:

‚Üí God doesn‚Äôt bless based on how much you give. The prosperity gospel teaches that bigger donations = bigger blessings, but that‚Äôs not how God operates. He blesses as He wills, based on the heart, not a dollar amount.

So, should we give? üôåüèæ Yes! But not because we‚Äôre forced to‚Äîbecause we trust God.

title: Is This Really The Face of Jesus Christ?
description:
Is this really the face of Jesus?

For centuries, the Shroud of Turin has puzzled scientists, historians, and theologians.

Some believe it‚Äôs the authentic burial cloth of Jesus Christ, while others claim it‚Äôs just a medieval hoax.  But what does the evidence actually say?

üî¨ Science still can‚Äôt explain how the image was formed. It‚Äôs not paint, ink, or any known artistic technique.

üìú Historians trace it back to the early centuries, possibly smuggled from the Holy Land before appearing in France in the 1300s. It was later moved to Turin, Italy, where it remains today.

‚úùÔ∏è The markings align exactly with what the Bible describes‚Äîwounds from scourging, a crown of thorns, pierced hands and feet, and even a side wound.

As a believer, I see this as just another powerful reminder that our God is real, Jesus Christ lived, and our faith stands on solid ground. No other religion has as much historical and physical evidence as Christianity.

BUT‚Äîthis shouldn‚Äôt be the only reason we believe. Our faith is built on God‚Äôs Word, and this is simply an additional reason to stand in awe and be grateful that He came in the flesh to save us! 

What are your thoughts?

title: Fear Tactics Exposed in Church Cults
description:
Whether you‚Äôre a Christian seeking to grow deeper in your faith or part of a group like Mormonism, Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses, or Seventh-Day Adventism, please know this: God‚Äôs love for you is not something you need to earn. üôèüèæ 

These groups often teach that works, like door-to-door evangelism, are needed for salvation, often leading to fear,  anxiety, and the burden of feeling like you‚Äôre never enough.

But the truth of the Gospel is this: Jesus already did the work for us. Through His sacrifice on the cross, we are saved by grace through faith, not by our own efforts (Ephesians 2:8-9). Salvation is a gift, not a reward for performance.

If you‚Äôre in a place where fear has been a part of your faith journey, I want you to hear this: Jesus invites you into freedom, not fear (Matthew 11:28).

To my brothers and sisters in these groups, this message is not meant to condemn but to invite. I encourage you to explore the true Gospel message of grace. Seek out a church that teaches the love and freedom found in Christ‚Äîone that aligns with the Bible‚Äôs teachings about the Trinity and the finished work of Jesus.

You are deeply loved by God, not because of what you do, but because of who He is. Praying for you as you take steps toward His peace and truth. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: 5 TRINITY Analogies That Teach Straight Up HERESY!
description:
Let's face it, the Trinity can be hard to understand. How can God be one God but also exist in three persons? Pastors and teachers have come up with some...interesting analogies over the centuries in an attempt to simplify and explain the Trinity, but unfortunately all of these analogies are totally wrong and actually introduce dangerous heresies that have been rejected throughout church history! In this video, I'll give you the top 5 analogies that are used for the Trinity, and explain the problem with each of them.

title: SHOCKING Evidence That Proves The Shroud of Turin Shows The Actual FACE of Jesus!
description:
In this captivating video, we delve deep into the centuries-old mystery surrounding the Shroud of Turin and explore the compelling evidence supporting its authenticity. The Shroud, believed by many to be the burial cloth of Jesus Christ, has intrigued researchers, historians, and believers for generations. Join us as we examine the scientific investigations, forensic analyses, and historical context that shed light on the remarkable features of the Shroud. From the faint image of a man's face to the intricate details of wounds consistent with crucifixion, we explore the tantalizing clues that suggest a direct connection to the life and death of Jesus. Prepare to be fascinated by the intriguing studies and thought-provoking theories that surround this sacred relic. Discover the latest findings and expert insights that may unveil the true origin of the Shroud of Turin. Are we witnessing an extraordinary artifact from biblical times? Join us on this intellectual and spiritual journey as we explore the authenticity of the Shroud of Turin.

title: The REAL Secret Behind My EXTREME Weight Loss Journey!
description:
Weight loss is NOT just a physical thing. It's a spiritual thing. The reality is that we have only ONE body to care for and steward and we honor God best by properly stewarding that body. That includes being in the best shape we can, managing our diet and exercising self-control. Last year I last 35 POUNDS in just over 90 DAYS! It was LIFE-CHANGING for me. Food was literally my IDOL for 46 years. Now, a year removed from my weight loss program, my weight has fluctuated within just 3-5 pounds from my ideal weight. Why? Because I developed habits that changed my life and I NEVER plan on going back. title: Was Jesus Crucified on Wednesday, Thursday or Friday?
description:
What day was Jesus crucified? Was it Wednesday, Thursday or Friday? Historically the church has believe that Jesus was crucified on Friday, hence the holiday Good Friday. However, many scholars have strong biblical support to suggest that Jesus was actually crucified on another day of the week, namely Wednesday or Thursday. This video will go through the three major views and discuss the strengths and weaknesses of each view.

title: Is Soul Sleep Biblical or Do Believers Go to Heaven When We Die?
description:
Is soul sleep Biblical? When we die, does our soul go to sleep or do we go into the presence of God? What exactly happens to a person when they die? Some will suggest a doctrine called soul sleep. They claim that when you die, you become unconscious and your soul "sleeps." Others claim you go directly to heaven if you believe in Jesus. This video will discuss the doctrine of soul sleep and evaluate it against the backdrop of what the Bible says about what happens when we die.

title: How to Live the Abundant Life Jesus Promised in 2022
description:
Guess what? 2022 is fast approaching and this is normally the time when people start making all sorts of goals and New Year's resolutions. But instead of making another "resolution" or creating a "vision board" or setting "goals" for next year, I'd like to suggest a different approach for this upcoming year that requires more intentionality. 

Jesus said that He came "that we might have life and have it more abundantly." Usually when people see that, they assume it is referring to financial abundance. While that may be part of it, I believe the abundant life is much more than that. On this LIVE STREAM I provide the exact strategy that I've been implementing in my own life and plan to continue in 2022 to live the abundant life. I want to share that with you!

title: Let‚Äôs Talk About Critical Race Theory
description:
Critical race theory has become one of the most talked about subjects in our society today. Many people have very strong opinions about critical race theory and whether it should be taught in our schools and in our communities and in our churches. It is also one of the most misunderstood subjects as well. 

If we are not careful we will allow issues and topics like critical race theory to divide us as Christians and create further discord within the body of Christ. title: Why Many Millennials are Leaving the Church and How the Church Can Win Them Back!
description:
Statistics show that many millennials are leaving the church in rapid fashion. Compared to previous generations, there is a mass exodus away from the church, or any organized religion for that matter, among many millennials. Why is this happening? Why are so many millennials disinterested in church? Are their reasons valid? 

Equally as important, what can the church do to reach millennials who are leaving church? What changes can the church make to attract more millennials to their services? This video speaks first to the millennial, or anyone who has left church for that matter, and analyzes whether their reasons for leaving are valid or not. In the second half of the video, I speak directly to the church and look at ways the church can practically win back a generation of people who are slowly turning away from the church.

title: Is Being a POOR Christian More "Christlike" than Being RICH?
description:
Is being a poor Christian more Christlike than being rich? Sadly, we live in a world of extremes. On one hand many people believe that if you are not prosperous then you are not in God's will for your life. On the other hand, some people are so afraid of wealth because they associate it with evil. They say it's more Christlike to be humble, meek, meager and "get by" with little so as to reflect the character of Christ. 

But, how exactly should we view this idea of Christians being rich or poor? Is it okay to be a Christian and have immense wealth or should we shy away from being rich and wealthy so that we reflect the character of Christ more? These and other questions we will explore in this video.

How do you give evidence that God exists without using the Bible? Let's say someone, a skeptic or atheist, says to you, "How can you know that your God even exists?" How would you answer them? Would you stumble or would you have arguments ready to discuss the existence of God?

In this video Dr. Frank Turek, an internationally known author and apologist, provides us with a solid framework for giving evidence of God existence.

title: The Book of Daniel in 90 Minutes | LIVESTREAM
description:

So, this live stream will focus on exactly that. This live stream will attempt to give a brief but DETAILED overview of the entire book of Daniel. 

The Book of Daniel contains both narrative and prophetic literature and remains one of the most fascinating books in the Bible. Understanding the Book of Daniel is critical for anyone seeking to be a student of end time events. Join us on this exciting study on the Book of Daniel and prophecy!

title: Can You REJECT The Trinity and Still Be Saved?
description:
Can you reject the Trinity and still be saved? To put it another way, do you have to have a full understanding of the Trinity in order to be saved? Is understanding the doctrine of the trinity a requirement for salvation? There is an ongoing debate surrounding this question that I want to address in this video.

The Trinity is a core tenet of the Christian faith and therefore must be accepted. But, what if someone does not yet fully understand the Trinity? Are they not a Christian? Should the doctrine of the Trinity be explained at the moment of conversion? These and other questions regarding the Trinity we will tackle in this video.

title: How to Defend Your Faith with Dr. Frank Turek | Apologetics 101
description:
If you want to be equipped to defend your faith and to be able to answer difficult questions the world has launched against Christianity, you need to attend this masterclass with Dr. Frank Turek. Dr. Turek is the host of the YouTube channel Cross Examined; a channel that reach millions of people worldwide. In this masterclass I'm going to be asking Dr. Turek some VERY difficult but popular questions that people typically ask about the Christian faith. 

The practice of defending your faith is called apologetics and the idea comes from 1 Peter 3:15 which states that we should ALWAYS be ready to give an answer for the hope we have. This is an opportunity to get some SOLID answers to difficult questions AND ask Dr. Turek some direct questions LIVE in the chat. YOU NEED TO WATCH THIS!

title: VERY DEEP Symbolism of the Holy Spirit in the Tabernacle - "The Golden Lampstand" - Part 5
description:
In the last video, we took a tour of the Bronze Laver in the Tabernacle of Moses. Now, it's time to step into the holy place and take one step closer to the presence of God in the Holy of Holies (which we will ultimately end up). In this video we will take a look at a piece of furniture called the Golden Lampstand. There is quite a bit of symbolism in this piece as you'll see in this video. Jesus is the ultimate fulfillment of this and every piece in the tabernacle as we have been discussing. As you'll see, this has so much relevance to us today in terms of how we relate to God in Jesus Christ. Come join me as we continue this exciting 3D tour of the Tabernacle!

title: GRIEF | HOW TO COMFORT SOMEONE WHO IS GRIEVING
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
GRIEVING: HOW TO COMFORT SOMEONE

What do you do and how do you respond when someone you love is experiencing a loss? That‚Äôs coming up next on the BEAT.

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for tuning in. Today we are asking the question, ‚ÄúHow do you comfort someone in a loss?‚Äù And the truth is that sometimes it‚Äôs awkward because we don‚Äôt really know what to do and what to say. We‚Äôre often afraid of saying the wrong thing. So, today I want to share with you 2 DON‚ÄôTs and 4 DO‚Äôs when comforting someone through a loss. 

1. DO NOT‚Ä¶
a. Assume the person wants or needs space. If this person is a true friend of yours, not only do they want to hear from you, they need to hear from you and they expect to hear from you. And if you don‚Äôt express your genuine concern for them it can compound their pain because the people closest to them were not there for them in their point of greatest need.
b. Talk too much ‚Äì The Bible says, ‚Äúlet every word we speak be HELPFUL and according to the NEED OF THE MOMENT.‚Äù 
i. This doesn‚Äôt mean don‚Äôt talk at all, it just means to use wisdom.
ii. Sometimes when we don‚Äôt know what to say to someone we say too much. What we need to realize is that when someone is experiencing the pain of a loss there really isn‚Äôt ANYTHING secular or spiritual that you could say that would remove or lessen the pain. 
iii. Say‚Ä¶‚ÄúWell, they are in a better place.‚Äù ‚ÄúHeaven has just received an angel.‚Äù ‚Äì The reality is that you don‚Äôt always know whether the person is going to heaven or not. ‚ÄúIt was their time.‚Äù ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll see them again.‚Äù
iv. The reason why we shouldn‚Äôt say things like this is because although we hope these things are true we don‚Äôt know for sure where the deceased person is.
v. Also, more importantly, at that moment the person doesn‚Äôt care about seeing that person in heaven. They miss them right now on earth. 

2. Prayers
a. Not just praying for them but praying with them.  
b. There is something encouraging that begins to happen when you lay your hands on someone who is in pain and they hear you cry out to God with all of your heart on their behalf. 

3. Presence
a. Job ‚Äì Health, Wealth, Family, Friends
b. This means recognizing that they are in a very vulnerable state and don‚Äôt need to deal with it alone.  
c. Weep with them. 
d. Listening to them for as long as they need. The key, once again, is not to do a lot of talking. 
e. Follow up with them every couple of days and during special days such as that person‚Äôs birthday or during the holidays to reassure them that they don‚Äôt have to walk through this alone. 

4. Provisions
a. The Bible says, ‚ÄúDo not withhold good to those who deserve it when it is in your power to help them.‚Äù
b. Ask them is there anything that they need? Often times when a person experiences loss they are in a state of denial or shock and for some time they won‚Äôt be able to think straight enough to do basic things.
c. So, offer to take them food, shop for groceries, doing housework, send them a gift card, watch their children, take them out to lunch or a movie, invite them over to dinner, etc. 

5.  Patience
a. In other words, don‚Äôt pass judgment on them if it takes them longer to process the pain of the loss than it takes you. 
b. Understand that depending on the depth of the loss this person may need some serious time to process the loss.

title: AM I A LUKEWARM CHRISTIAN? | THE LOVE THAT GOD HATES
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
AM I A LUKEWARM CHRISTIAN?

The Bible says that God is love. But there is one type of love that God hates. That‚Äôs coming up next on the BEAT.

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for tuning into the BEAT. Today we are talking about what it looks like to be a worldly Christian. And it is my belief that one of, if not the biggest, problem within Christianity today is that too many Christians profess to be Christians but the lifestyle would say otherwise.  The Bible teaches that there are four classes of people (non-Christian, baby Christian, worldly Christian, spiritual Christian). Let‚Äôs look at how God feels about worldly Christians.
 
1. James 4:4 ‚Äì Speaking to Christians James reminds them that, ‚ÄúFriendship with the world makes you an ENEMY of God.‚Äù
2. Rev. 3:15-16 ‚Äì So He‚Äôs not saying I wish you were saved or unsaved. But rather he is suggesting that COLD water is good and useful and so is HOT water but lukewarm water is USELESS and He wants to SPIT it out of His mouth!  

So what exactly does it look like to be a worldly Christian? Let‚Äôs break this up into two categories. 

BELIEFS
1. Rom. 12:2 ‚Äì Do not be conformed to the pattern of this world. In other words, don‚Äôt let the world system that we are surrounded by squeeze you into its mold. But instead be TRANSFORMED by renewing your mind. 
2. A recent poll showed that 57% OF ALL PROFESSING CHRISTIANS BELIEVE THAT THERE IS ANOTHER WAY OTHER THAN JESUS TO GET TO HEAVEN?
3. When Christians believe that because our society has evolved that it‚Äôs now okay to redefine marriage to be between two people from the same sex, that‚Äôs a worldly belief. 
4. When you believe that it‚Äôs okay for two Christians to live together before marriage because it‚Äôs more economically feasible CHRISTIANITY IS TRENDING TOWARDS WORLDLINESS. 
5. And Jesus says, ‚ÄúWhen I see lukewarmness I want to spit you out of My mouth.‚Äù
6. The reason why this angers God is because it reveals that we fear the rejection and value the opinions of men more than we do God. 

The second thing that characterizes a worldly Christian is not only their BELIEFS but also their BEHAVIOR. 
1. Comfortable in sin
a. When you are living in perpetual sin AND your heart is no longer tender and grieved over it that is a sign that you‚Äôre trending towards worldliness. 
b. The Bible describes this as a ‚Äúseared‚Äù conscience; comparing it to skin that is now burnt and insensitive to feeling. 
2. Spiritual Stagnancy ‚Äì Paul said to the Corinthian church, ‚ÄúI could not talk to you as I would spiritual people. I had to talk as though you belonged to the world.‚Äù Why? Because they had not progressed in their understanding of God to the point where they would even be able to receive deeper teachings from Paul. It‚Äôs natural for us to have high and low seasons but if you are not growing spiritually over a long period of time you could be trending towards worldliness. 
3. Worldly Love ‚Äì Finally John described worldliness as people who are controlled by the lust of the flesh (people who are dominated by things that gratify their fleshly desires), lust of the eyes (people who lust after what they see and as a result their minds are obsessed with obtaining more and more wealth and possessions rather than giving to others), and the pride of life (people who are absorbed with themselves and things that make them look good in front of other people.)

For more info on this subject check out chasegodtv
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3z6ux_ehslo

title: WHICH BIBLE TRANSLATION SHOULD I READ? | BIBLE TRANSLATION REVIEW
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
WHICH BIBLE TRANSLATION SHOULD I READ?
Which Bible version is best for me? 

You got KJV, NASB and now the Message. And so today I want to talk about the three different types of Bible translations and the pros and cons of each. 

No Bible Translation is Perfect
‚Ä¢ The original Bible was written in Hebrew, Aramaic and Greek [which is why most theological schools teach Greek and Hebrew] meaning men had to interpret what they believed the text was saying. 
‚Ä¢ The problem is that there are close to 5 million words in the Biblical Greek language and only 1 million English words making it very difficult to always find an exact English word or phrase that reflects the true meaning of the biblical text. 

1. ‚ÄúWord for Word‚Äù Translations ‚Äì These versions are normally written at a 11-12th grade reading level. 
a. This is where the translators attempted to take each word from the Greek/Hebrew (Aramaic) and translate it to English preserving the exact word order
b. One example of this type would be the King James Bible
i. Pros ‚Äì The translators prided themselves on translated the Greek/Hebrew manuscripts word for word preserving the authenticity of the original manuscripts.
ii. Cons ‚Äì The problem is that it was translated in 1611 in Old English words that are over 400 years old.
iii. So, not only are there words like thee, thou, whither and comest, restoreth that we no longer use but there are other words that mean something totally different today than they meant in 1611.
c. Amplified ‚Äì Another one in this category is the AMP Bible which is one of my absolute favorites. 
i. Pros ‚Äì It adds key words and phrases in brackets to help you better understand what you are reading.
ii. Cons ‚Äì The words they add are left up to the interpreter who added them.  

2. ‚ÄúThought for Thought‚Äù ‚Äì NIV, NLT
a. This is where the translators took whole phrases and tried to capture the general idea of what the phrase was saying and then disregarding the original word order and then translated it into English. 
b. Examples of these would be the New International Version and the New Living Translation
c. Pros ‚Äì They are written at a 7-8th grade reading level making it very easy to understand which is great because the Bible is already hard to understand. 
d. Cons ‚Äì Some of the original meaning can be watered down in an attempt to make it more readable.

3. Paraphrase ‚Äì The editors took whole chunks of the Bible and did not even try to attempt to translate it literally but rather they put it in very modern words that people can understand. 
a. The most popular paraphrase today is the Message Bible. 
b. Pros ‚Äì it is the easiest Bible to read aimed to be read at a 4-5th grade reading level. 
c. The obvious con here is that a paraphrase disregards the meaning of individual biblical words and they take liberties in adding more words in an attempt to make it more readable which then makes it subject to the interpretation of the translators.  

So, what‚Äôs the best one to use? The one that you enjoy reading the most and the one you feel that God speaks clearest to you. I personally subscribe to the NLT because I‚Äôve found it to be the best combination of accuracy and clarity and when I read it I actually understand what the Bible is saying. I would only use a paraphrase, such as the Message Bible, as a secondary resource only after I‚Äôve read and studied from an actual bible translation.

title: HELP! I KEEP SINNING! | WHAT TO DO WHEN YOU'RE STUCK IN SIN
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
HELP! I KEEP SINNING! HOW TO FESS UP WHEN YOU MESS UP!

What do you do when you keep committing the same sin again and again? That‚Äôs our topic today on the BEAT.

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for tuning into the BEAT. Today we want to talk about what to do when you find yourself struggling with the same sin again and again and you may not be now but I can assure you that at some point you will have something that no matter how hard you try you can‚Äôt seem to stop going.  [I wish someone would‚Äôve told me these things when I was a younger Christian because I did it all wrong.] So today I want to share with you 5 DOs and 5 DON‚ÄôTs.
 
DOs
1. Confess your sin ‚Äì 1 Jn. 1:9 ‚Äì Even if you have to confess the same sin 10 times every day. Confess it. The reason why we do is because it reestablishes fellowship with God. 

2. Accept God‚Äôs Free Gift of Grace ‚Äì Rom. 5:20

3. Try to Identify the Root Cause of Why ‚Äì Many people deal with the fruit and not the root and never ask the question, ‚Äúwhy am I struggling with this sin?‚Äù And so because they never ask the question they seldom get the answer. 

4. Accountability ‚Äì Proverbs 18:1; 14:12; 11:14; James 5 ‚Äì Let‚Äôs face it. If you would‚Äôve been able to conquer this sin on your own by now you would‚Äôve done it. The enemy wants you to live in secrecy where you feel so ashamed of what you‚Äôre doing that you can‚Äôt share it with anyone. 

5. Reestablish Intimate fellowship with God ‚Äì Ps. 119:11 ‚Äì When you do your chances of committing sin are less. Remember that Dusty Bibles lead to Dirty Lives.

DON‚ÄôTs
1. Don‚Äôt think you have lost your salvation ‚Äì Listen, the very fact that you are experiencing a strong sense of remorse over your sin is ongoing proof that the Holy Spirit is alive and well doing His job inside of you.

2. Don‚Äôt live in condemnation ‚Äì Rom. 8:1
a. Don‚Äôt start beating yourself up living a depressed life thinking that the more depressed you make yourself the more impressed God is with your spirituality. God never requires us to get depressed over our sin. 
b. Sometimes we think we need to create some sort of buffer time between when we sin and when we get back with God because if we try to get back with God too quickly it means we aren‚Äôt taking our sin seriously. 
c. When we do this leads us to create distance between ourselves and God to where we don‚Äôt feel worthy to pray, read our bible, worship or share our faith with others making us ineffective. 

3. Don‚Äôt try to do something good to make up for your sin ‚Äì Isa. 64:6 ‚Äì It doesn‚Äôt work like that. 

4. Don‚Äôt make promises to God you can't keep

5. Don‚Äôt Rationalize it ‚Äì Prov. 28:13 ‚Äì Don‚Äôt make excuses for your sin. 

If you know someone struggling with sin in their life (just about all of us), please pass this video along to them. And remember, Dusty Bibles lead to Dirty Lives.

title: HOW TO RESOLVE CONFLICT...THE RIGHT WAY!
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
HOW TO HAVE DIFFICULT CONVERSATIONS WITH YOUR SPOUSE

How do you have a conversation with your spouse or anyone for that matter that you know is going to be a difficult one? That‚Äôs coming up next on the BEAT.

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for tuning into the BEAT. Today we are talking about having ‚Äúdifficult conversations.‚Äù Every couple, including my wife and I as recent as this week, are going to have to have difficult conversations no matter what you see people posting on Facebook. And so today I don‚Äôt have a lot of scripture but I want to share with you 7 practical tips that my wife and I are trying to practice in our marriage so we can have healthy yet difficult conversations.

1. Don‚Äôt Avoid Them
a. When we avoid obvious issues in our relationships it basically means that we are settling for a second-class mediocre marriage. And what happens is there is an obvious elephant in the room. And we think that over time that elephant will disappear but on the contrary the longer we leave it there the bigger it gets.
b. Resentment begins to build which leads to separation which then leads to fake intimacy in public where you act like you‚Äôre happy to impress others but behind closed doors there is no true intimacy. 
c. So my first piece of advice is that the worse thing you can do is ignore or avoid the issue, but rather see how confronting the issue can actually heal your marriage and bring you closer together. 

2. Do not criticize someone for something they cannot change ‚Äì This is called ‚Äúnot fighting fair.‚Äù This leads someone to feel as though you don‚Äôt accept them the way they are and because they can‚Äôt change it they will never be fully accepted in your eyes, which can be devastating to any relationship especially in marriage.  Number three‚Ä¶along those same lines‚Ä¶

3. Do not criticize your spouse for something you knew before you married them ‚Äì When we consistently do this it sends the subtle message that had you known this before you would've made a different decision in terms of marrying them. 

4. Avoid Using Absolutes
a. This is something that we‚Äôve often told not to do but seldom do people tell you why. The reason is, for one, it‚Äôs not true. Generally a person doesn‚Äôt always do something or never do something. But second‚Ä¶
b. When we use the words ‚Äúnever‚Äù and/or ‚Äúalways‚Äù what it does is that it immediately puts the person on the defensive because now instead of listening to you they are thinking about examples that can counter your ‚Äúnever/always‚Äù statement. ‚ÄúWell what about last week when I did this? And last month I did it twice! And what about you? You never do this for me!‚Äù 
c. And then it just gets bad. Get those two words out of your vocabulary when you‚Äôre having difficult conversations. 

5. Stick to the Issue ‚Äì As difficult as it is try to stay focused on the specific issue that is being discussed. Why?
a. First of all, when we bring up issues from the past it reminds the other person that we have not yet fully forgiven them for past mistakes.
b. Second, it distracts you from addressing and ultimately resolving the original issue that was brought up because now more than likely you‚Äôre addressing another issue. Stay focused on the issue at hand.
 
6. Don‚Äôt Deflect ‚ÄìThe natural tendency when someone confronts you about you is to immediately lash back and bring up something about them instead of receiving what they are saying. Receive it, pray on it and then ask God to show you if there is any truth to what they are saying and what needs to change within you. When people get defensive when difficult issues are brought up, the other person takes note of that and then are less likely to bring up anything in the future in fear that it will turn into WWIII. So your defensiveness leads them to shut down, internalize the issue and live in fear right in their own home. 

7. Don‚Äôt be afraid to bring in a third party ‚Äì When you see a certain symptom again and again regarding your health you go to the doctor. When there is an issue that consistently comes up that creates arguments and tension you can either allow this issue to further deteriorate your relationship or you and your spouse can humble yourselves and get help from a variety of different unbiased, Christian counselors, professional or non-professional that can help you work through it because often times, for whatever reason, your spouse will receive a message better from someone else than they do from you. 

And so today I want to encourage you with this quote as you are dealing with conflict. Remember, ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather lose an argument to my spouse than to lose you my spouse to an argument.‚Äù

title: WHEN YOU FEEL STUCK IN LIFE!
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
WHEN YOU FEEL STUCK

What do you do when you‚Äôre doing everything you know how to do and you just feel STUCK in life?

Hey everyone, my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for tuning in. I don‚Äôt know about you but there have been times in my life where I just feel stuck. Nothing‚Äôs working. Doors seem to be closed. People around you are getting blessed and if you‚Äôre not careful you‚Äôll sink into depression wondering if your change is ever going to come. So today I want to share with you from the word of God 3 lessons that I believe God desperately wants us to learn in these seasons of our lives where we can‚Äôt seem to break through and I want to give you one word to hold to for each lesson.  

And so today we want to look at a man named Joseph who did everything right. God had given him some amazing dreams for his life and yet in Gen. 40 he finds himself stuck in prison. The first lesson I believe God would have us to learn is a lesson on testing‚Ä¶

1. Testing
a. There is a beautiful scripture in Psalm 135 that says, ‚Äúuntil God fulfilled Joseph‚Äôs dreams God was testing his character.‚Äù 
b. God often gives us tests in life. The Bible says God ‚Äútested Abraham.‚Äù He ‚Äútested‚Äù the nation of Israel in the wilderness. The Bible says that the testing of our faith produces perseverance and it says in Romans that this perseverance ultimately produces character in our lives. 
c. When Joseph was sold as a slave he was under a test. How is it going to respond when things don't go his way? Would he forgive his brothers for selling them into slavery? Will he still continue to do his best on a job that is beneath him and he's overqualified for? Or would he give half effort, complain to those around him, and constantly look ahead instead of being present? How would he respond when falsely accused? How will he respond when people mistreat him? Will he respect, honor and submit to the people in authority over him or will he talk negatively about the people who are over you? How will he respond when he's tempted and everything in his flesh wants to give in to that sexual temptation? The way we respond to all of these tests when we feel STUCK demonstrates and develops greater character in our lives. 
d. KEY WORD: RESOLVE ‚Äì Resolve to demonstrate good character.
2. Trust
a. Later in this amazing story of Joseph‚Äôs life he finds himself now in prison and he forms a great relationship with a man who was also innocent who was getting ready to get released to go back and work for the king. And Joseph says to him, ‚Äúwhen you get out remember me and put in a good word for the king. I‚Äôm not supposed to be here!‚Äù 
b. Often times we say we trust God. We sing songs about trusting God. We tell other people how they can and need to trust God. But when we are stuck in life it reveals whether we are putting our trust in God or in man. 
c. Who is your trust in? Man or God? Tests often times reveal who we are trusting in. So many times we put our trust in our connections, our resources, our possessions, our education, our experience instead of God. When we get stuck we think "I've got what it takes to get myself out of this." God‚Äôs got you. God knows exactly where you are and how long you‚Äôve been in your situation. And He‚Äôs already gone ahead of you to make provisions for your next assignment that you don‚Äôt even know about. 
d. KEY WORD: REST ‚Äì Be still and know that God is God. Don‚Äôt force things and put your trust in God.
3. Timing
a. The Bible says that after two full years in prison that Joseph was released. But he wasn‚Äôt just released; God had promoted him to being the second most influential person in the entire land IN HIS TIMING.  I can imagine Joseph thinking, ‚Äúwhy did I have to stay in prison for TWO years?‚Äù 
b. The question is, ‚Äúdo we think with our finite minds that we know more than God?‚Äù Or can we say like the psalmist said, God I don‚Äôt understand what you‚Äôre doing but, ‚ÄúBut I trust in you, O Lord‚Ä¶and my times are in your hands.‚Äù
c. KEY WORD: RELINQUISH ‚Äì Relinquish your timetable of when you think things should happen in your life and trust God‚Äôs timing because just as the heavens are above the earth so are His ways higher than ours.

title: THE OBJECTIFICATION OF WOMEN: A Biblical Perspective
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
MY THOUGHTS ON THE OBJECTIFICATION OF WOMEN ‚Äì DONALD TRUMP

Hey everyone, I‚Äôm sure by now we‚Äôve all heard of the statements that Donald Trump has made that are slowly being released. And I want to share my thoughts on it. Now let me go on the record by saying that in no way and I‚Äôm endorsing Hillary Clinton, nor am I trying to bash Donald Trump but rather I simply want to focus specifically on the statements that he made some ten years ago and are being released now and I think there are just a few things we can learn.

1. Be Careful Not to Judge
a. I think we as Christians need to be just a little careful not to judge him as a person but rather judge the words that he has said. I‚Äôm reminded of a story in the Bible where a woman who was caught in the very act of adultery was brought to Jesus. And she was surrounded by a crowd of people with stones in their hands ready to throw he in a pit and stone her to death. And Jesus said, ‚Äúwait a second, if there is anyone who is here who is without any sin then you can be the first to person to throw the stone.‚Äù And the Bible says they thought about it for a second and one by one from the oldest to the youngest they put their stones down and left. Now was Jesus condoning this woman‚Äôs behavior? No. But He was teaching a lesson that we should be quick to look at ourselves first before we cast judgment on someone else. 
b. All I‚Äôm simply trying to say is that if someone were to go back and look through all of our emails, voicemails and text messages from 10-20 years ago they just might find some things that we are not proud of today. 

2. Words Matter
a. The Bible says, ‚ÄúA fool expresses all of their emotions, but a wise person controls them.‚Äù I think the lesson here is to be extra careful to filter what comes to our minds so that it doesn‚Äôt come out through our mouths. 
b. The Bible says, ‚ÄúOut of the overflow of the heart the mouth speaks.‚Äù In other words, what we say reveals what‚Äôs in our hearts which leads people not only to judge what we say but who we are. 
c. So we need to be careful because we never know how something we say or do today can affect us some time down the road which is why it‚Äôs critical that we always live our lives above reproach. 

3. Own it 100%
a. The next thing I‚Äôd say is that when people catch us in the wrong in any arena in life whether it may be in relationships, at church, at work or in this case in politics, our best response is to just own it 100% and apologize deeply for the hurt you‚Äôve caused the other person. 
b. There are two things I that I noticed about Donald Trump‚Äôs apology. First he said, ‚Äúif‚Äù I offended anyone I apologize suggesting that there was a possibility that his words were not offensive.
c. But more importantly he apologized but then said that it was just ‚Äúlocker room talk‚Äù and that ‚ÄúBill Clinton has said even worse things to me on the golf course.‚Äù 
d. When we add anything to a confession it appears as though we are trying to exonerate ourselves which then takes away from the genuineness of the confession and it comes off that we are trying to justify what we‚Äôve done by suggesting that other people do it too. 

4. Objectification of Women
a. Finally I‚Äôd say that we as Christian men need to be careful that we don‚Äôt objectify women. The statements that are made in the locker room that we think are no big deal, the jokes we laugh at, tell and share with others, the women we gawk at at the gym simply communicates our approval that women are to be objectified as sex objects. 
b. Certainly watching pornographic material would also constitute as endorsing the objectification of women.
c. We must remember that non-Christians are constantly looking at us to see if we are going to be examples of Christ-like character and when we objectify women we‚Äôre not doing what Jesus would do, we‚Äôre acting just like the world does. 
So guys, I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts on this. Please share them below in the comments section. Thanks so much I‚Äôll see you next time on the BEAT.

title: How Should Christians Vote?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
How Christians Should Vote?
How do you vote when you don‚Äôt agree with either candidate? That‚Äôs our topic today on the BEAT.

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for tuning into the BEAT. Today we are asking the question, ‚ÄúHow Should A Christian Vote?‚Äù particularly in situations where you might not agree with either candidate. So today I hope to provide a few principles that can govern not who we vote for but how we vote.
1. Remember that our ultimate hope is not in a person or a party it‚Äôs in God
a. So no matter who is in office God is sovereign and the Bible says that the heart of the King is in the Lords hand. 
b. It also says in Romans chapter 13 that every authority is established by God. So this just simply means that if the candidate that you choose does not happen to get in the office not only do we still have hope that God's sovereign will will be done, but we must also remember that we have not only a civil but a spiritual responsibility to pray for and support whoever is elected.
2. Don't feel obligated to a two-party system
a. In other words, there is no scripture in the Bible that commands you to vote Democrat or Republican. On the contrary it says that we will be held accountable not only for the evil deeds we do but also when we ‚Äúgive approval to those who practice them.‚Äù 
b. If you cannot in any good conscience cast your vote and show your support for either candidate without feeling as though you are supporting some gross immorality then you are under no civil, moral or spiritual law to vote for either of them. 
c. On the contrary you have the right to publicly communicate your beliefs by voting independent or for a third party. 
3. Don‚Äôt Vote Party or Personality Vote Principles
a. With that being said, be careful not to elevate one issue as being more biblical, Christian or near to God's heart than another simply because it‚Äôs more personal to you
b. For instance, according to the Bible, taking care of the poor and dealing with the social injustices that are running rampant in our country is just as near and dear to the heart of God as the lives of unborn children or same-sex marriages.
c. So I would say study what the Bible says about these issues and then ask God to lead you to vote on the ones you feel are nearest to God‚Äôs heart and which ones would impact our country the most.
4.  Vote on Character
a. As one person said until Jesus runs for president you will always be voting for the lesser of two evils (lowest approval rate of any two candidates in history).  
b. So the question we should ask ourselves is, ‚ÄúWhich person's character do I trust more to make decisions under pressure that can and will affect our country as a whole?‚Äù 
c. The best way to assess this is to look at how they‚Äôve demonstrated character in the past. How do they make decisions? How do they treat people? Are they trustworthy? Do they show genuine care for mankind?
5. Be Informed on the Issues
a. Instead of casting an emotional vote because of how someone looks, our predisposed opinion of them, the way our family normally, their gender or the color of their skin, instead take the necessary time to be informed and aware of as many issues as possible so that we can make an educated decision on who to vote for. 

So, this is a controversial topic but we don‚Äôt shy away from these topics on the BEAT so I would LOVE to hear your thoughts on this please leave the in the comments section below. Thanks so much for watching and I‚Äôll see you next time on the BEAT.

title: PHILIPPIANS 4 | "I CAN DO ALL THINGS THROUGH CHRIST"
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Hey what's up everyone, today we conclude our series in the book of Philippians chapter 4. And I want to break this up into three parts. First, there is a prayer we need to pray. Second, there is a principle we need to learn. Finally there is a promise we need to claim. 

Prayer to Pray
1. Command
a. Do not be anxious ‚Äì the word means to be pulled in so many directions
b. Why? Anxiety is the number one thing that will steal and rob us of joy.
2. Pray
a. About everything ‚Äì This lets us know that God is concerned about the most minute details of our lives. 
b. Petition ‚Äì Specific request for benefit
c. Thanksgiving ‚Äì Grateful acknowledgement of God‚Äôs blessing
3. Result
a. Peace exchange ‚Äì ‚ÄúYou give me your weight and in exchange I‚Äôll give you my peace.‚Äù 
i. This peace is the result of knowing that you are transferring the weight from you to God and you‚Äôre putting the ball in God‚Äôs court and you can now hold God to fulfill His promises to you. 
ii. It will surpass all human understanding and comprehension. 
iii. Peace OF God ‚Äì It‚Äôs a peace that ONLY God can give to you that the world won‚Äôt understand. It‚Äôs the result of knowin
iv. This peace will guard your heart (from wrong feelings) and your mind (from wrong thinking).
4. Principle to Learn
a. Contentment ‚Äì The first thing that we notice is that Paul said that he ‚Äúlearned‚Äù how to be content in all circumstances which means this is NOT something that just happens overnight. This is something that is learned over time and through experience. 
b. The key to his contentment was twofold.
i. POWER: Christ who gave him the strength. Phil. 4:13 has been one of the most misquoted verses in the Bible. People rip this verse out of content to suggest that we can do anything we put our minds to like run a marathon, become a doctor, become a professional athlete. But Paul isn‚Äôt referring to any of that. Rather, he is talking about being able to be content whether he‚Äôs ballin‚Äô on top or struggling to provide. 
ii. PERSPECTIVE #1: Paul clearly had the right perspective on material things. In 1 Tim. 6:6-8 he says, ‚Äúwe came into the world with nothing and we will leave with nothing. So with food and clothing I‚Äôll be content.‚Äù Now I admit I‚Äôm not there yet! But because Paul had the right perspective he was able to experience contentment. 
iii. PERSPECTIVE #2: Secondly, Paul understood that temptations come with both being rich and being poor. It‚Äôs interesting here that Paul said he had to ‚Äúlearn how to be content being rich.‚Äù He understood that when you‚Äôre rich you will experience different temptations. First, to feel self-sufficient and to trust in your wealth rather than in God. And secondly the temptation to be greedy because once you get a taste of wealth you want more and more.  If you‚Äôre poor you may be prone to steal or resort to unethical means to provide for yourself (see Prov. 30:7-9).
c. LESSON: It‚Äôs easy for us to be content when we have more than enough. The true test of our faith is how we respond in the low seasons when our change is strange and our money is funny. 

Promise to Claim
1. Paul says here that God will supply all of our needs. The problem is that we get our needs mixed up with our greeds.

title: Breaking generation curses | HOW TO BREAK FREE FROM GENERATIONAL CURSES
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Breaking generation curses:
What is a generational curse and how can we break it? 

Hey what‚Äôs up family today we are talking about The idea of generational curses comes primarily from Exodus and verses similar to that referring to the effects of sin being passed down to the 3rd and 4th generation. And so today I want to answer three questions. What is it? How does it get into our families? How can we break it? 

1. What is it? It‚Äôs a specific pattern (teen pregnancy, divorce, pornography, anger, abuse, adultery, alcoholism) that is deposited into the family where the family members will be more predisposed to repeating because of heightened exposure to it.  
2. How does it get there? I want to look at three stages by focusing in on three words in this verse. 
a. STAGE #1 ‚Äì INIQUITY ‚Äì There are several words used in the Bible to describe offense to God (sin, transgression, trespass) and then the word used here which is iniquity. The Hebrew word iniquity is deepest level of sin and literally means something that is ‚Äúbent‚Äù or ‚Äúdeformed.‚Äù 
b. It refers to a specific weakness or stronghold in our lives that comes as a result of consistently, willfully sinning against God without repentance.  
c. STAGE #2 ‚Äì VISITING ‚Äì Notice it says that this ‚Äúiniquity‚Äù in us will ‚Äúvisit‚Äù the children down to the 3rd or 4th generation. Some versions translate this word as ‚Äúpunish‚Äù but the literally meaning is to visit or to call. So when we have iniquity or strongholds in our lives, we deposit that into our family and it comes visiting and knocking on the door of our children and our children‚Äôs children. We still have the choice to open up and let it in. But without the power of the Holy Spirit we will more than likely not have the spiritual power to continue to shut the door in sin‚Äôs face. 
d. STAGE #3 ‚Äì HATE ‚Äì Doesn‚Äôt refer to hatred but rather choosing or preferring something else over God. 
2. How do we break it?
a. Realize the power we have ‚Äì Unfortunately many people never read the rest of the verse that says, ‚Äúbut showing mercy to thousands of generations who love me.‚Äù This lets us know that not only can we break the cycles in our families but even more importantly we also have the power to create new ones that reflect God‚Äôs righteousness and pass those down to thousands of generations.  
b. Stop Blaming our Family
i. The bible says, ‚ÄúWhy do you quote this proverb? The parents ate sour grapes and now the children‚Äôs teeth are set on edge.‚Äù Meaning because my parents did it then I‚Äôm prone to be like them. 
ii. If you are a Christian we can no longer blame who we are and the decisions that we make on our family or our upbringing. We cannot use our family background as an excuse to stay the way we are because the Holy Spirit who lives in us now gives us the power we need to break any cycle or stronghold that has been deposited into our family. 
c. Get Accountability ‚Äì James says to ‚Äúconfess your sins to one another so that you can be healed.‚Äù Even though we have the power to break any cycle we must also remember that because of what we were exposed to we will always be more strongly tempted in this area than others, which is why we need people to keep us accountable. 

So, can Christians experience generational curses? NO. Can Christians be affected by the consequences of generational cycles?
