title: HOW TO RESPOND WHEN PEOPLE MISTREAT YOU!
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
WHAT TO DO WHEN PEOPLE KEEP MISTREATING YOU

How do you respond when someone continually mistreats you again and again? That‚Äôs coming up next on the BEAT.

Hey what‚Äôs up everybody my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for visiting my channel. Here on the BEAT we release a new video every Tuesday and today I want answer the question, ‚ÄúWhat do you do? How do you respond when someone close to you continues to mistreat you whether it may be at work, at church or even at home?‚Äù In Rom. 12 Paul gives us 6 clear steps on how to handle it. Number 1

1. Speak Well & Don‚Äôt Curse them ‚Äì Paul says, ‚ÄúBless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse.‚Äù As difficult as it is try and find something positive to say about them, wish the best for them, pray for them, while at the same time resisting the temptation to gossip about them, ruin their reputation or speak negatively about them.  

2. Set an Example for others ‚Äì Paul says, ‚ÄúBe careful to do what is right in the eyes of everyone.‚Äù Other people are watching you and when you take the high road and consistently seek good for those who mistreat you are setting the example of great character for others to emulate.‚Äù

3. Initiate Peace ‚Äì Notice he says, ‚ÄúIf it is possible [meaning sometimes it isn‚Äôt], as far as it depends on you [meaning you can‚Äôt control the other person; only your own actions], live at peace with everyone.‚Äù Even if the person you are in conflict with is wrong God still says you do EVERYTHING in your power to initiate peace in the relationships because if the relationship doesn‚Äôt work you can say that you did your part to seek reconciliation. 

4. Leave room for God ‚Äì Next he says, ‚ÄúDo not take revenge‚Ä¶but LEAVE ROOM for God‚Äôs wrath.‚Äù When we seek to get even ourselves I believe this verse implies that God takes His hands off of it and says, ‚Äúwell if you think you can do a better job then you handle it.‚Äù Take your hands off of the situation. God says it belongs to Him anyway. Leave room for God to do KNOWING by faith that no injustice or mistreatment escapes His view.

5. Do Something Good for them ‚Äì Paul says, ‚ÄúOn the contrary, when your enemy is hungry, feed him‚Ä¶when you do you will heap burning coals on his head.‚Äù When you do something good for someone who doesn‚Äôt deserve it your good actions will often times cause them to feel convicted and ashamed because they will naturally compare their mistreatment towards you to your good forcing them to come face to face with their own behavior.

6. Don‚Äôt Allow Someone Else to Change your Character ‚Äì Finally, Paul says, ‚ÄúDo not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.‚Äù In other words, be careful NOT to allow someone else‚Äôs evil and mistreatment to turn you into an evil person all because you want to get revenge because when you do you not only have become just as low as them but you‚Äôve also given someone else control over your own emotions. 

So guys, you may be in a difficult situation at work, at church, or even in your own home. I want to encourage you today to do what God is requiring of you and to trust God‚Äôs word because it works. By faith, resist the urge to get even and trust that in God‚Äôs timing He will not only bless you for responding with character but He will also deal with the person who is mistreating you.

title: Do Prophets Still Exist Today?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Do Prophets Still Exist Today?

In other words can God still use someone to tell you something about your future? That‚Äôs coming up next on the BEAT.  

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for visiting my channel. Here on the BEAT we release a brand new video every Tuesday and today we are talking about the controversial subject of prophecy and whether this gift still exists today. And so I want to give you 3 things that I see that are different about prophets in the Bible and modern-day prophets then end by answering the question ‚Äúwhat should you do when someone comes to you and says ‚ÄòI have a word from God for you‚Äô‚Äù

1. Prophets confronted SIN and called to REPENTANCE
a. The prophets of the OT challenged the people head-on on sin issues that they were dealing with in that day (whether it may be immorality, adultery, idolatry, oppression of the poor, obstruction of justice, etc.) and then called the people back to repentance. 
b. These guys were HATED by the people and often times got stoned because their message consisted of things people DIDN‚ÄôT want to hear rather than telling them what they DID want to hear
c. This is a very different message than what we hear today where modern-day prophets often avoid confronting our generation on issues of sexual sin, adultery, divorce, abortion and instead focus more on things they know people do want to hear such as pronouncing blessing, prosperity, healing and financial breakthrough over people‚Äôs lives.  
   
2. Prophets were SPECIFIC not GENERAL
a. You ever go to a church service and someone who claims to be a prophet says ‚Äúthere‚Äôs someone in here with cancer? And that could be like half the people in there.‚Äù 
b. There is someone sitting on the third row who went to the doctor on Thursday and got diagnosed with pancreatic cancer who has been given 3 months to live. 
c. Prophets in the Bible were very careful to make sure that they were truly Deut. 18:20 says, ‚ÄúStoned which means they were very careful to make sure they were speaking on behalf of God‚Äù which means we need to be very careful about saying that we ‚Äúhave a word from God‚Äù for someone or ‚ÄúGod told me to tell you‚Ä¶‚Äù
d. So, when you are assessing whether someone is a prophet or not make they are specific with their prophecies. 
e. Accurate ‚Äì they came to pass 100% of the time. There was no hit or miss with a true prophet.
f. And the didn‚Äôt depend on whether the people receiving it had enough faith to believe it. 

3. Prophets were not MOTIVATED by MONEY
a. You got so many prophets today who will charge people an arm and a leg to attend a conference knowing how desperate people are to hear a word from God. Then when they get into the conference they promise people a financial blessing if they further sow a seed into their ministry. 
b. The prophets in the bible lived and led very humble lives which is much different than much of what we see today. WITH ALL OF THAT BEING SAID‚Ä¶

What should you do when someone speaks a word of prophecy over you?
a. Receive it because it could very well be that God is trying to get a message to you through them ‚Äì 1 Thess. 5:20-21
b. Check it against the Scripture because God never contradicts Himself and the Bible says He is not the author of confusion. He will never tell a prophet something to tell you ‚Äì 1 Jn. 4:1
c. Ask God to confirm it to you ‚Äì I‚Äôve seen people adjust their entire lives and make decisions based on what a self-proclaimed prophet told them only to later discover that person didn‚Äôt hear from God but it was too late. 
d. Ask God for wisdom ‚Äì James 1:5

So, does the gift of prophecy still exist today? I don‚Äôt see anywhere in the Bible that clearly says it doesn‚Äôt but the problem is you may have to sift through a few false prophets who will lead you astray to get to a true prophet.

title: Why Good People Have Affairs
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
WHY GOOD PEOPLE HAVE AFFAIRS

How does a person go from being happily married to having a full-blown affair? That‚Äôs the question we want to answer today on the BEAT. 

The number of marriages where one or both spouses admit to having either a physical or emotional affair is 41%. Why so high? Well today I want to give you 5 reasons why good people have affairs. 


1. They Lack a Fear of God
a. The Bible says, ‚ÄúThe fear of the Lord is the BEGINNING of wisdom.‚Äù So even if your marriage is horrible and everything in you wants to cheat, fearing how God is going to discipline you keeps you from making a decision you‚Äôll regret later. 
2. Assuming someone else can make them happy (read Lk. 15:
a. So what happens is this. A single person is unhappy with themselves. They meet someone and fall in love and that person makes them happy. But once the infatuation wears off they become bored in their marriage and they revert back to who they really are which is someone who is unhappy. But in their minds they equate their unhappiness with a deficiency in their spouse. So they crave that feeling of happiness again and go out and find someone else who will make them happy. And they do‚Ä¶for a short time until they revert back to being unhappy again. 
b. This is a dangerous deceptive pattern because instead of addressing the emptiness within they seek happiness in a relationship not realizing that it is impossible for anyone to make you happy. 
3. Comparing your spouse‚Äôs WORST to someone else‚Äôs BEST
a. The problem with doing this is what we see in other people is only what they want us to see not realizing that they too come with their own set of deficiencies but because you don‚Äôt see them on the surface it‚Äôs easy to assume they are not there. 
b. The more you compare your spouse‚Äôs WORST qualities with what appears to be someone else‚Äôs BEST qualities the more you will be tempted to cheat. The way to combat this is to constantly remind yourself of all of the wonderful things that your spouse brings to your life.
4.  Not cutting off ‚Äúinnocent‚Äù friendships
a. You know you‚Äôre attracted to someone and so instead of cutting it off you play with it and flirt with it because in your mind it‚Äôs innocent not realizing that the more we entertain it the more connected you become and the more connected you are the more difficult it is to sever the relationship. 
b. So when you‚Äôre having issues with your spouse you‚Äôve left the door open for the enemy to use this relationship as a temptation to cheat.
5. No accountability ‚Äì living a life of secrecy ‚Äì Prov. 18:1
a. Many affairs could be prevented by early detection. In other words if you have godly accountability, they can often times perceive that you‚Äôre flirting with the idea of an affair.   
b. But many people refuse to live in community, become open and transparent with someone else and give someone else the right to ask them the hard questions.  

Affairs can have devastating long-lasting effects on your spouse in terms of pain and your children as well. So if you are struggling in your marriage I want to encourage you to consider the long-term consequences of such a decision.

title: What Does it Mean to Step Out on Faith?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
What Does it Mean to Step Out On Faith?
HOOK: What does it mean to step out on faith? 

INTRODUCTION: Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for visiting my channel here on the BEAT we release a brand new video every single Tuesday and today we want to answer the question, ‚ÄúWhat exactly does it mean for someone to step out on faith?‚Äù And for this we turn our attention to the greatest chapter on faith Hebrews 11 and I want to zoom in on one man named Abraham and we pick up his story in verse 8. 

1. Faith obeys the WORD FROM GOD ‚Äì ‚ÄúBy faith Abraham, WHEN CALLED.‚Äù
a. I want you to notice something here that many people miss. 
b. Noah ‚Äì The Bible says Noah ‚Äúwas warned‚Äù about the flood, so as a result by faith he went and built an ark. 
c. Abraham ‚Äì It says Abraham ‚Äúwas called‚Äù so as a result he left everything‚Ä¶ 
d. These men didn‚Äôt just come up with an idea, make a major life decision and say, ‚ÄúGOD I‚ÄôM STEPPING OUT ON FAITH NOW BLESS IT!‚Äù Their decision was preceded by a word from God.
e. So if you don‚Äôt sense a strong leading by God Himself then stepping out on faith is not for you. 
2. Faith is willing to DELAY GRATIFICATION ‚Äì vs. 8 ‚Äì ‚ÄúHe would later receive‚Ä¶‚Äù
a. When you step out on faith you must be willing to accept the fact that what you want to receive from God may or may not happen for some time. 
b. Abraham ‚Äì 25 years
c. Joseph ‚Äì 13 years
d. So if you‚Äôre someone who is looking for an immediate blessing then stepping out on faith is not for you.  
3. Faith moves FORWARD without all of the FACTS ‚Äì ‚Äúeven though he did not know where he was going.‚Äù
a. Stepping out on faith means you understand that God only gives you enough information to see right in front of you and He often times conceals the details about the journey along the way. 
b. So if you‚Äôre someone who needs the facts before moving forward stepping out on faith is not for you. 
4. Faith is willing to leave that which is COMFORTABLE ‚Äì ‚Äúlike a stranger in a foreign country‚Äù
a. This one is so difficult for many of us. We value comfort, predictability and certainty. 
b. The problem with that is if we value it too much we will never see God‚Äôs power.
c. When God calls you to an act of faith you must be willing to leave your family, a romantic relationship, a job, a church, etc. and this is why you must be sure that God is leading you because these are major decisions with major implications that could alter your entire life. 
d. Don‚Äôt make them without prayer and seeking wise counsel. 
e. So if you‚Äôre someone who values COMFORT then stepping out on faith is not for you.  
5. Faith believes in the Supernatural power of God ‚Äì vs. 11
a. ‚ÄúFaith COMMANDS you to do something you‚Äôve CONVINCED yourself can never be done.‚Äù
b. If you can do what you believe God is calling you to do without God then it‚Äôs not faith. 
c. So if you‚Äôre someone who only believes in the NATURAL then stepping out on faith is not for you. 

I don‚Äôt know what decisions you may have coming up but I want to encourage you to pray, seek wise counsel and if you believe that God Himself is leading you then step out on faith and trust that God will lead you every step of the way.

title: Does God Support Polygamy?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Does God Support Polygamy?

What do Abraham, Jacob, Esau, David, and Solomon have in common? All of these great men of God had multiple wives. So, does God support polygamy? That‚Äôs the question we want to answer today on the B.E.A.T.

INTRODUCTION: Hey what‚Äôs up everybody my name is Allen Parr and so the question comes up, ‚ÄúDid God permit Polygamy?‚Äù This is a tricky question and one that needs to answered carefully Well there‚Äôs actually one verse in the OT that seems to CLEARLY suggest He did (Deut. 21:17). So, in this video I want to look at 1) some of the REASONS why some men had multiple wives; 2) the RESULTS of those decisions and then finally 3) the RELEVANCE for us today. 

1. Men had multiple wives for a variety of reasons
a. Barrenness ‚Äì Sometimes it was because their wife was unable to have children and further the family lineage.
b. Protection for Women ‚Äì Other times they were providing protection for women because due to many men dying in war there was a disproportionate number of women to men and women were unable to provide for themselves so men would step up and take extra wives to provide support and covering (sadly women were often forced into prostitution to provide for themselves)
i. Deut. 25:5 ‚Äì There is even a scripture that encourages a man to marry his brother‚Äôs wife if the brother died without children. 
ii. And so the idea here is do you become a polygamist or do you force that woman to possibly become a prostitute?
c. Alliances ‚Äì Sometimes it was to forge alliances with other nations and so kings would trade wives to secure the partnership. 
d. Greed ‚Äì Other times men like David chose to take on wives for selfish reasons. 
e. But even though, interestingly enough on one occasion God says to David, ‚ÄúWhy did you have to go and steal someone else‚Äôs wife? If the ones you had weren‚Äôt enough I would have given you more‚Ä¶‚Äù (Is God condoning polygamy?)

2. The RESULTS of Polygamy
a. Whether it‚Äôs a sin or not, interestingly, each time a man took on more than one wife in the Bible it created major problems and divided the home.
b. We can look at Abraham and his two wives, Jacob and his 2 wives + 2 concubines, we can look at the situation between Hannah and Peninnah which was an absolute nightmare, David and his wives and Solomon‚Äôs heart turned away from God because of his 700 wives.
 
3. The RELEVANCE for us today
a. God Established His institution of marriage at creation ‚Äì The Law of First Mention ‚Äì God‚Äôs design for marriage is very clear and is outlined in both the OT and the NT. In Gen. 2 God says, ‚ÄúAnd the TWO shall become ONE.‚Äù Jesus then confirms this in the NT (Paul says the same thing about church leaders needing to be ‚Äúthe husband of ONE wife.‚Äù (see also Eph. 5:22-33 and Col. 3:18-19)) where He repeats the very same scripture found in the OT. So anything outside of God‚Äôs original design cannot be His perfect will.
b. Don‚Äôt confuse God‚Äôs PERMISSIVE will with His PERFECT will ‚Äì There are many things He allowed but doesn‚Äôt desire. 
c. Don‚Äôt take something that God is DESCRIBING and interpret it as God PRESCRIBING it ‚Äì David cursed his enemies in prayer does that mean we should do it? When interpreting the Bible be careful not to take isolated events and then make them normative for every believer (poison, snakes, etc.) Does that mean that because it worked for them we should do it?
d. Just like God blesses and uses us despite our many sins in the same way God was patient to bless many men in the OT who took multiple wives. So instead of asking, ‚ÄúWhy or how could a holy God bless someone like that?‚Äù Instead ask, ‚ÄúHow could God overlook some of the stuff that I‚Äôve done and still bless me in spite of what I do?

So did God allow polygamy for various reasons in the OT? I think we have to safely say that He did. But has that ever been God‚Äôs perfect will for a marriage relationship? I think we can safely say NO.

title: The Secret to Praying for Prosperity
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
THE SECRET TO PRAYING FOR PROSPERITY

Let‚Äôs say you have an idea, a business or a ministry that you want God to bless. How do you pray? That‚Äôs coming up next on the BEAT.

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you all so much for visiting my channel. Here on the BEAT we release a new video every single Tuesday and today I am SO excited to share with you a short but powerful prayer that I‚Äôve been praying particularly over the past couple years that God has been faithful to answer. This prayer is only one verse long but it has four parts to it and it can be found in 1 Chronicles 4:10.  

1. Pray for God‚Äôs Blessing ‚Äì The prayer starts out by saying‚Ä¶‚ÄúOh that you would bless me indeed‚Ä¶
a. So here you‚Äôre simply humbly asking God to bless you, your business, your idea or whatever it is you are trusting God for. You‚Äôre not coming naming and claiming or demanding anything from Him but rather recognizing that again and again in His word God invites His children to let our requests be made known to Him. 
b. Did you know that there were some things that ONLY happened in the Bible because people were bold enough to ask God to do it? 
c. I‚Äôm reminded of a man named Hezekiah who was on his death bed who cried out to God and said, ‚ÄúGod would you be so gracious to extend my life?‚Äù And God essentially said, ‚ÄúBecause you asked I‚Äôm going to add 15 years to your life.‚Äù 

2. Pray for Influence rather than Affluence ‚Äì ‚Äú‚Ä¶enlarge my territory‚Ä¶‚Äù
a. Here is when we check our own motivation as to why we are asking God to bless us. 
b. God give me a bigger business so that I can have a wider sphere of influence on more people so I can make an eternal impact on their life and trust that as your influence expands God will bring the affluence if it‚Äôs His will.
c. So if your motivation is to reach more people for Jesus Christ with your idea then why would God not want to enlarge your territory?

3. Pray for Favor ‚Äì ‚Äúand that your hand might be with me‚Ä¶‚Äù
a. This is where you ask God to do what you cannot do. This is where the natural stops and the supernatural takes over. It‚Äôs where your Preparation meets God‚Äôs Providence‚Ä¶
b. It‚Äôs here that you recognize that no matter how skillful, intelligent, and resourceful you are you cannot accomplish what God wants you to accomplish by yourself. You need God‚Äôs power and His favor upon you because when God‚Äôs hand is on something it CANNOT be stopped!
c. So here you are praying for two primary things‚Ä¶
i. RELATIONSHIPS/PEOPLE ‚Äì Bring the right people to me to help me pull this off. Pray that God would supernaturally ordain the right relationships. Give me favor with people. Open up the right doors and opportunities. 
ii. RESOURCES/PROVISIONS ‚Äì You‚Äôre praying for God to provide supernaturally. You‚Äôre praying that you would literally see the hand of God working behind the scenes so that you have the confidence to know that God has your back on what you‚Äôre asking Him for. 
iii. REACH/PROMOTION ‚Äì Pray that God would promote you to help you reach the people He intends for you to reach. 

4. Pray for Protection ‚Äì ‚Äú‚Ä¶keep me from harm that I may not experience pain.‚Äù 
a. Here you are praying that God would protect you from people who are jealous, envious, vindictive, have secret agendas and people who don‚Äôt have the best interest at heart for whatever it is you are trusting God for. 
b. Pray that God would keep you and your business covered from any and all attacks that may distract, derail or ultimately destroy you. 

This one verse although short is packed with power! So I want to encourage you to start praying these four things over your life, your family, your business and your ministry or any other idea you‚Äôre trusting God for today and trust God to prosper you as He sees fit. 

Let this prayer be not something you quote verbatim necessarily but a guide for how to pray. 




There is something within us that is often times uncomfortable to ask God to bless something that we are doing. But I want you to notice one thing. This is not name it and claim it. He did not come to God in a prideful way demanding that God give him a specific blessing. He left that up to God and simply said, ‚ÄúGod in whatever way you want to bless me I‚Äôm content.‚Äù 

Be bold to ask God to bless your business ‚Äì What I love is that he let God determine how he wanted to bless him (financially, people, etc.)

title: Why Does God Allow Evil And Suffering?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
WHY DOES GOD ALLOW EVIL AND SUFFERING?

The number one question that people would ask God would be, ‚ÄúWhy did you allow so much Evil and Suffering?‚Äù That‚Äôs coming up next on the BEAT. 

Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for visiting my channel. Here on the beat we release a new video every single Tuesday and today we are tackling the tough question, ‚ÄúWhy Does God Allow Evil and Suffering?‚Äù This is a question that people have asked since the beginning of time and has been coined, ‚ÄúThe Atheist‚Äôs Most Potent Weapon‚Äù and the argument goes like this. Either A) God is helpless and not all-powerful because if He was He would be able to put a stop to evil and suffering. Or B) God is not a good and loving God because good and loving God will allow suffering and evil. So atheists are like, ‚ÄúSee I gotcha! You don‚Äôt have an answer!‚Äù But there actually are some answers that God has revealed in the Bible (you may or may not like them) and I want to share several of them with you today. 

PREMISE: That everything in this universe belongs to God which means He has the right to do whatever He desires to do with it because it belongs to Him.

1. Sometimes God allows SUFFERING because He has a Greater Purpose For It that we cannot see
a. The greatest example of this is the crucifixion of Jesus Christ. As evil and gruesome as it was God allowed it because He had a greater purpose in mind, specifically that you and I could become Christians, receive complete and total forgiveness of our sins and live for eternity with God. 

2. God uses SUFFERING to get our attention and turn us towards God
a. I‚Äôm reminded of when in the OT God was trying to get Israel‚Äôs attention because they had backslidden. And in one text God said, ‚ÄúI killed your young men with the sword‚Ä¶yet you still did not return to me.‚Äù In other words I used that to get your attention to draw you back to me. 
b. In the same way the Sunday after 9/11 churches attendance was at an all-time high. Could it be that God used the tragedy of 9/11 to get our attention as a nation and turn us back towards Him. 

3. Sometimes God allows suffering to DISCIPLINE individuals or nations
a. In the OT a king by the name of David had an adulterous affair with a woman named Bathsheba. And God chose to discipline him by allowing the child of the affair to die. 
b. In the same way that we discipline our own children, He does this as an act of love so we don‚Äôt do something more destructive to our own lives. 

4. God allows SUFFERING to make our TESTIMONY stronger [God‚Äôs #1 priority is not our happiness]
a. In Hosea 1 God says, ‚ÄúHosea, I want you to marry a woman who will one day commit adultery on you because I want you to know personally how it feels to love someone unconditionally who continues to be unfaithful to you so that when you are speaking to the people you‚Äôll know personally how I feel when they continue to be unfaithful to me‚Äù 
b. In the same way God uses your suffering to make you stronger so that you can comfort people from a place of experience rather than intellectual knowledge. 

Now I recognize that none of these answers provide comfort to those who have experienced deep suffering but what it should do is get us to take our eyes off of this temporal existence and place our focus on heaven where the Bible says there will be no more death, no tears, no sorrow and no pain.

title: SOCIAL MEDIA AND CHRISTIANITY
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Is Social Media our Frenemy?

Hey guys my name is Allen Parr thank you so much for visiting my channel if you enjoy this video we release new videos every Tuesday and today I want to talk about some traps [some of which I have been guilty of] that I see so many people falling into when it comes to social media. I have 7 of these so let‚Äôs‚Ä¶jump‚Ä¶in!
 
1. Coveting ‚Äì This is when we covet someone else‚Äôs platform, their success, their influence, their following, how many likes, comments and shares they get, etc. And what can end up happening is that we can fall into the trap of getting our validation or seeking some semblance of self-worth from social media. Let‚Äôs say you post something (post, picture, video) and you think, ‚Äúman this post is about to go viral‚Äù and to your surprise you only get three likes and someone else posts some foolishness and gets like 300 likes within 1 hour. If you‚Äôre not careful you will begin to internalize this as people must not like me because they didn‚Äôt like my post instead of realizing that it very well may be that they never saw your post because of Facebook‚Äôs secret algorithm.
2. Venting
a. The Bible says a fool gives vent to all their feelings but a wise person holds them back‚Ä¶
b. It‚Äôs not the right forum for that
c. In your attempt to try to make someone else look bad you‚Äôre actually making yourself look bad and emotionally weak. 
d. It‚Äôs an act of cowardice to put someone on blast without giving them the opportunity to defend themselves and share their side of the story.
e. Defaming someone‚Äôs character if it‚Äôs an individual and you‚Äôre stealing potential customers from a business. 
So next time you‚Äôre tempted to vent write it all out in your status and then check the box that says post ONLY TO ME!
3. Comparing ‚Äì One of the things that is easy to do is to compare your reality with someone else‚Äôs highlight reel. And so if you only look at what people post about their marriage, their children and their careers online you‚Äôll think their situation is perfect not realizing that people generally only post their highlights not their lowlights and the enemy will start to play tricks with your mind causing you to think that your situation sucks because you don‚Äôt have what you think they have.    
4. Squanders time ‚Äì The latest statistics show that the average American spends 3.5 hours a day (9 for the average teen) on social media and probably 3.5 minutes a day reading the Bible. The Bible teaches us to ‚Äúmake the most of our time‚Äù and to ‚Äúnumber our days.‚Äù We could spending that time investing into ourselves or investing into others so we need to REALLY consider whether this is the best use of our time.  
5. Trap of Secrecy ‚Äì over 20% of all divorces are the result of a secret online relationship. Social media is conducive to having secret relationships with so-called friends or old acquaintances that your spouse or significant other knows nothing about. Trap #3 is the COMPARISON TRAP‚Ä¶ 
6. Distracts us from building relationships ‚Äì You can be out with friends and instead of engaging in meaningful conversation you are distracted by scrolling through countless news feeds, snap chatting with someone across the world, looking up a photo on pinterest or following someone‚Äôs post on Instagram. And what this does is it sends the message to the other people that they are important enough to deserve your undivided attention. 
7. Co-signing/support ‚Äì 2 Cor. 5:20 ‚Äì What we like, share, and support is not only a reflection of you but as a Christian it is a reflection of Christianity as a whole. So when we like something that has a message that is worldly or inconsistent with the Bible (such as the law on same-sex marriages) we are putting our stamp of approval on this saying that we are in agreement with what someone else posted which has the potential to lead someone to believe that all of Christianity is in support of it because you are a representation of a bigger group of people.

title: The Book of Revelation Explained in Under 5 Minutes
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
THE BOOK OF REVELATION EXPLAINED IN UNDER 5 MINUTES!

Have you ever wondered what the book of Revelation is all about? 

INTRODUCTION: And today we are talking about the book of Revelation, a book that has several different interpretations and one that many Christians avoid reading and some are even afraid to read it. But today I want to take you through a 7-fold chronological journey through the book of Revelation.

1. Background ‚Äì Rev. 1:1
a. Name ‚Äì The name of the book comes from the first verse, ‚ÄúThe Revelation of Jesus Christ‚Äù which lets us know that this book is all about the unveiling or uncovering of the person, plan and power of Jesus Christ.
b. Written in 95 A.D. by the Apostle John who also wrote the gospel of John and the letters 1, 2, and 3 John

2. Letters to Churches ‚Äì Rev. 2-3
a. Letters from Jesus to 7 churches in Asia minor and each church 
b. Each letter exposes some aspect of the churches in that day and the modern day churches
c. These chapters represent the church age in which we currently live

3. Tribulation ‚Äì Chapters 6-19 ‚Äì The next thing that will happen is the church will be raptured and the tribulation will begin. 
a. This represents a 7-year period of time after the church has been raptured where God allows those who are left behind one final opportunity accept Him as Savior. 
b. But the catch is that , because there is no church wickedness and evil are rampant throughout this section making it very difficult for people to choose Jesus. 
c. The final 3 ¬Ω years of this period are what‚Äôs called the Great Tribulation. And man it‚Äôs gonna get bad (no drinking water, painful sores, sun will get so hot it will scorch the skin of men.‚Äù

4. The Battle ‚Äì 19
a. After these things there is the battle of Armageddon. It won‚Äôt be much of a battle because Satan and his armies will be severely destroyed by Jesus. 
b. Satan will be bound for 1000 years

5. 1000 year reign ‚Äì Rev. 20:6 ‚Äì This is the actual Second Coming of Jesus Christ. All Christians from all time will reign physically on earth with Jesus. Satan will be bound during this time so there will no demonic influence for 1000 years.

6. Judgments ‚Äì Rev. 20:11-15 ‚Äì Satan & every unbeliever who has ever lived will then stand before God and be judged for their sins and then cast into the Lake of Fire for eternal separation from God.

7. New Heaven & New Earth ‚Äì Rev. 21:1 ‚Äì 
a. Interestingly enough there are only 4 chapters in the bible where there is a perfect environment (Gen. 1-2 & Rev. 21-22). 
b. And so what we see here is the magnificent story of God coming full circle and God reestablishing the perfect environment that He had intended. 
c. The Bible says that the earth, which is decaying every day, is not fit for eternity so God will destroy this current earth and create a new heaven and a new earth where we will dwell with Him throughout all eternity.

I hope this short video if nothing more will encourage you to study this book and see the awesome plan God has the future and most importantly that this book will give us as Christians the comfort in knowing that no matter how crazy things appear in this world that God was, is and always will be in complete control.

Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

title: Top 5 Verses Christians Take Out of Context
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
The Top 5 Verses Christians Take out of Context

Have you ever heard someone quote a scripture and you wonder, ‚Äúis that what that scripture really means?‚Äù Today we are going to talk about the importance of CONTEXT! 

Hey what‚Äôs up everyone my name is Allen Parr and here on the BEAT we release a new video every Tuesday and so today we are talking about scriptures that Christians commonly take out of context and I want to give you my top 5.

1. ‚ÄúJudge not, or you will be judged‚Äù 
a. This verse is often used to suggest that people don‚Äôt have the right to judge other people. You may hear someone say, ‚Äúyou can‚Äôt judge me, the Bible says you can‚Äôt judge‚Ä¶‚Äù
b. BUT, if you look at the context more carefully Jesus is NOT prohibiting all judgment but rather He is saying that before you judge someone else take some time to look at yourself first so that you will be able to see clearly enough to administer a proper judgment on something.
2. ‚ÄúConsider it all joy when you experience various trials‚Äù
a. This verse is often used to somehow suggest that when we experience hard times the Christian response is to ignore our human emotions and rejoice and thank God for your trial.
b. But when we look at the context it‚Äôs not saying that we should rejoice when negative things happen to us but rather we rejoice in what the trial produces in our lives which is the ability to persevere and to make us a complete well-balanced Christian. 
3. ‚ÄúWhere two or three are gathered together in your name there I will be in the midst‚Äù
a. This verse is usually quoted when no one shows up for prayer meeting to encourage the saints to pray anyway OR if we are going through a difficult time and we have 2 or 3 people praying for us‚Ä¶
i. First problem is that if you‚Äôre a Christian Jesus is with you all the time whether you‚Äôre by yourself or in groups of two or three
ii. Second problem is that the context is talking about how to resolve conflict in the church between two people and if there are at least two to three credible witnesses in agreement then Jesus says I will be in the midst of that conflict resolution. 
4. ‚ÄúSpeak those things that are not as though they are‚Äù ‚Äì this verse has been misused by so many people to suggest that if we have enough faith we have the ability to create our own destiny simply by speaking things into existence. 
a. The problem with this one is if you read the passage carefully it clearly says that that God is the only one that is able to call something into existence that is not. 
b. You and I cannot twist God‚Äôs hand and force Him to do something outside of His will simply by speaking it because that puts us in the position of God and God in the position of a servant. 
5. By His stripes we are healed ‚Äì Now people have used this verse when they are praying over someone who I sick suggesting that through Jesus‚Äô death on the cross (i.e. His ‚Äústripes‚Äù) we are healed of any sickness and disease. The problem with this is‚Ä¶
a. If you trace the Hebrew word for heal throughout the entire book of Isaiah you‚Äôll see that every time it is used to refer to God spiritually healing a nation of people who have backslidden and He is healing them of their spiritual sickness. 
b. We know it‚Äôs not talking about sickness because in the NT Peter quoted this same verse and the context clearly proves that the idea of being healed is spiritual and not physical. 
c. Peter used this same verse in the NT and helps us understand the meaning of the original text to refer to a spiritual healing and not a physical one. 

My hope and goal with this video is that we would all be much more careful when speaking for God and make sure that we are quoting scriptures in the right context and not just saying things that we‚Äôve heard other people say or even your pastor say or the common Christian clich√©. Remember that when you take the text out of CONtext, you get CONNED every time!

title: Boost Your Leadership with These Six Principles
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Boost Your Leadership with These Six Principles 

QUESTION: What are the qualities that separate leaders from great leaders? Today I want to show you how to maximize your leadership potential.

Many of us find ourselves in leadership positions even if we don‚Äôt want to be, whether it may be at work, our own business, at church or at home. I‚Äôve been blessed to be around some amazing leaders. And so today I want to point out 6 qualities from the life of Jesus that every great leader I know possesses and the first is‚Ä¶

1. Leaders possess‚Ä¶PASSION
a. Jesus was passionate about what He was leading. One time He even went into the temple and flipped over all of the tables (Mt. 21:12)
b. A great leader exhibits passion. One of the reasons why the morale on certain teams is low is because the morale of the leader is low. 
c. If you want to maximize your leadership potential be sure you are passionate about what you‚Äôre leading and that you communicate that passion to your team.  
2. Leaders win with‚Ä¶PEOPLE
a. Every great leader knows how to win with people. 
b. Communication
i. Clear ‚Äì People on your team should not have to ask you questions about things that should have been communicated to them. 
ii. Consistent ‚Äì For a leader there is no such thing as too much communication. People would rather hear from you too much than not at all. Over-communication is a leader‚Äôs best friend. 
iii. Compelling ‚Äì Does it call people to action? 
iv. Charismatic ‚Äì ‚ÄúSpoke as one having authority‚Äù There was something about the way Jesus spoke that crowds gathered around Him. Great leaders are often great speakers. 
c. Motivation ‚Äì This involves getting the best out of people and making them feel important to where they want to do what they can to help you.  
d. Delegation ‚Äì A leader understands the principle of multiplication and making others feel empowered to carry out your vision. 
3. Leaders see‚Ä¶POSSIBILITIES
a. In other words great leaders aren‚Äôt afraid to take risks to do what‚Äôs never been done before. 
b. Jesus was attempting to do something that had never been done in the history of time which was to unite Jews and Gentiles together. That was a risk‚Ä¶
c. But in order to be a risk taker you must first overcome your fear of failure. 
4. Leaders solve‚Ä¶PROBLEMS
a. Every great leader is able to not only solve problems but they have the discernment to foresee and plan for them before they come. 
b. Jesus foresaw the problem of sin and executed a plan to solve it by dying on the cross for our sins. 
5. Leaders exhibit‚Ä¶PERSEVERANCE
a. Jesus was on a mission to fulfill His divine purpose of dying on the cross. He didn‚Äôt allow opposition to deter him from his mission.
b. Anything you attempt to do for God or just in general you will encounter opposition. Great leaders may get discouraged but not deterred. 
6. Leaders demonstrate‚Ä¶PROGRESS ‚Äì Lk. 2:52 ‚Äì The Bible says even Jesus grew in wisdom‚Ä¶
a. A great leader recognizes that they must always be progressing to stay ahead of the people they lead. This means that a leader is always a reader and a leader is always a learner. 
b. See 1 Tim. 4:12

So I pray that you would use this as a checklist to grade your leadership as you strive to maximize your leadership capacity.  I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts on leadership leave them in the comment section below.

title: Do Christians Need to go to Church?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Why do People Need to Go to Church?

Have you gotten strayed away from going to church on a consistent basis? Or you‚Äôre going but you‚Äôre not involved? Today I want to talk about why you need to get back in church.  

INTRODUCTION: Hey everyone my name is Allen Parr and thank you for visiting my channel. We release new videos every single Tuesday and today we are talking about why it‚Äôs important to go to church. I‚Äôm not sure what your reason is for not going consistently but I want to give you 5 reasons why you should go to church. 

1. Christ
a. Jesus went to the place of worship every Saturday consistently. So, if we want to be like Jesus we should attend regularly. 
b. Also, the Bible refers to the church as the bride of Christ (Eph. 5:24; Rev. 19:7-9) which means it‚Äôs the most important thing to Him. So when we neglect or disregard the church as not being important, what we are saying is ‚ÄúJesus I love me some you, but I don‚Äôt love your wife.‚Äù 
2. To Contribute
a. One of the biggest problems is that people see church primarily for what they can get out of it instead of what they can contribute to it. 
b. I‚Äôve got news for you. The church needs you. You have experiences, gifts, talents and a testimony that someone in the church is not benefitting from what you have to give because you are not involved. 
c. Might I remind you also that the Bible is very clear that one day we will have to give an account to God for how we used the gifts He‚Äôs given us. 
3. Children
a. Even if you don‚Äôt believe in regular attendance, do it for your children. Church is a great place for them to learn about moral, ethical behavior and to receive a solid foundation that the Bible says that when they get older there is a high likelihood that they won‚Äôt depart from it.  
b. It can also be a place for them to discover their gifts and talents and learn about the value of community at a young age. 
c. Also, statistics show that couples who attend church together are 35% less likely to divorce than couples who don‚Äôt. 
4. Community
a. Care ‚Äì When you are going through your most difficult seasons of life the church is designed to be a place where you can be surrounded by people who genuinely care about you, will pray for you and hold you up at times when you can‚Äôt stand by yourself. Also within community is‚Ä¶
b. Counsel ‚Äì The church is a great place to go if you‚Äôre going through a difficult time in your life and you need counsel or maybe you have a big decision to make and you need someone to help you process it.
c. But also within this community are opportunities for you to grow spiritually through Bible studies, conferences, or the Sunday morning experience. 

The fifth and final reason is somewhat of a selfish one but that is‚Ä¶

5. Connections
a. Wherever you want to be in life you will not get there alone. And so‚Ä¶
b. The church is a great place to make personal and professional connections that may help you get your family and/or your business where you want them to be. 

ENCOURAGEMENT: So I‚Äôm not sure what your reason is for why you don‚Äôt go to church but I want to encourage you first of all to forgive those who may have hurt you in church and then to find a church that is committed to teaching the word of God and one that you can experience the blessing of true, genuine, authentic community.

title: How to Pursue a Woman...The Right Way
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
How should a Christian man pursue a Christian woman? That‚Äôs our topic today on the BEAT

What‚Äôs up everybody it‚Äôs your boy Allen here so today I want to talk to the single men and give some advice on how we can pursue a woman.

DISCLAIMERS: There is no biblical formula for how to pursue a woman or how to date (dating was not an issue in their culture). I confess that I did not personally see the value in these principles before I started courting my wife.
 
And so with that being said, I want to suggest 6 principles for how we men can get this right. (SCREEN: Ladies I need you would help us by holding us accountable to these 6 principles.)

1. Check Yourself ‚Äì In other words, be honest about where you are emotionally and whether or not you are in the right place to spiritually lead a woman. 
2. Consistency ‚Äì Women can‚Äôt STAND a man who doesn‚Äôt follow through with what he says so make sure your actions are consistent with your words. 
3. Clarity ‚Äì It is so important to women for us to be crystal clear about what our intentions are from the jump. This has several benefits‚Ä¶
a. Sets you apart from other men who are interested in playing games
b. Establishes your leadership which she craves and desires
c. When you don‚Äôt it sends the message that she‚Äôs good enough to kick it with but not good enough to commit to. Once you‚Äôve established clear intentions‚Ä¶
4. Caution ‚Äì Be careful to avoid physical contact early on because‚Ä¶ (ladies hold us accountable‚Ä¶)
a. CONTACT without COMMITMENT = CONFUSION
b. When a man becomes physical with a woman 
i. ‚ÄúWhat is it about me that is good enough for him to lay up on but not commit to?‚Äù
ii. ‚ÄúHow many other women is he kissing on since we are not exclusive?‚Äù 
iii. ‚ÄúIs this just a physical thing?‚Äù
c. With each contact it engages her heart even more and puts her in a very insecure place 
d. Something else to consider is that not only are you protecting her and her heart but you‚Äôre protecting yourself because if the relationship doesn‚Äôt work 
e. But if you don‚Äôt it can have devastating effects on her self-esteem, can damage her trust in men and make it more difficult for the man that God sends to pursue her next. While it may be easy for us to move on, often times she may be left dealing with emotional pain of another broken relationship. 
5. Community or Covering
a. In other words‚Ä¶find out who are the most influential people in her life. 
b. If she mentions that she has a spiritual covering such as a pastor, mentor, life group leader or even her father it would be in your best interest to make your intentions known to them. 
c. HUGE! Because‚Ä¶these are the people she trusts, respects and listens to. So it‚Äôs best to let these people know who you are and get them on your side early on. 
d. Now let me be clear, you are NOT asking for permission but simply making your intentions known. 
6. Character ‚Äì (Prov. 31) 
a. Many of us get so caught up in the physical attraction and ignore the character and then after the physical wears off we move on searching for something more. Pay more attention to the qualities you need in a wife not a girlfriend. 
b. Studies show that even in good marriages couples have sex for about 2 hours a week. It‚Äôs her character that will keep you engaged the other 166. 

I wish someone would have told me this a long time ago. So guys the good news is that God doesn‚Äôt expect us to be perfect before we pursue a woman. But I hope this list gives us something to shoot for as we experience the challenges of dating.

title: What to do when You're Angry at God?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
What do you do when you are angry, frustrated and disappointed with God and your dreams turn into nightmares? That‚Äôs the question we want to answer today on the BEAT. 

INTRODUCTION: What‚Äôs up everyone, Allen here and today I want to take a close look at the life of Job, a man who lost all ten of his children, all his wealth and his health and I want to give us four things to consider when we are angry, frustrated and disappointed with God. 

1. Release your emotions to God ‚Äì Job 23:2-3, 8; elsewhere he even said, ‚ÄúCursed be the day I was even born!‚Äù 
a. Job was ANGRY with God not only because of what he was going through but because it seemed like God was nowhere to be found and while experiencing incomparable pain he was bold enough to express his true feelings towards God. 
b. And many of God‚Äôs greatest servants were at one point in their life very angry with God and yet God was patient with them, loved them through it and blessed their life.
i. Naomi ‚Äì She lost her husband and her two sons and shook her fists in God‚Äôs face and 
ii. Hannah ‚Äì Was bitter because she could not have children. 
iii. David ‚Äì ‚ÄúMy tears have become my food!‚Äù
c. So, my first encouragement to you if you are angry with God, God already knows what you‚Äôre feeling. Stop feeling guilty about it. Release it to God and be encouraged to know that you are in good company of people who have been disappointed with God.  
2. Recognize that God could be testing you ‚Äì Job 23:10
a. Job said, ‚Äúeven though I can‚Äôt seem to find God anywhere in my trial, I KNOW that His eyes are still on ME! And when He TESTS me‚Ä¶‚Äù
b. Don‚Äôt start blaming yourself for what you‚Äôre going through when it could very well be that God may be testing you today and that test is more for you to see where you REALLY are because the true temperature of your faith will be revealed in the tests and trials of life. 
c. Peter said, ‚Äúthese trials will show that your faith is genuine. It is being tested as fire tests and purifies gold.‚Äù (1 Pet. 1:7a). This leads me to my third point which is‚Ä¶
3. Resolve to Obey God during your test ‚Äì Job 23:11-12
a. One of the temptations when you are in the midst of a trial is to say, ‚ÄúGod this Christian thing isn‚Äôt working! Prayer, obedience, fasting and church attendance is getting me NOWHERE!‚Äù And you end up making poor decisions and reverting back to a habit, a person or a lifestyle that God has delivered you from. 
b. But Job said, ‚ÄúI have stayed on God‚Äôs path; I have followed His ways and not turned aside; I have not departed from His commands.‚Äù Elsewhere he said, ‚Äúalthough you slay me God, YET I will trust you!‚Äù 
c. When we revert backwards I am a firm believer that we may be prolonging the time of our own test. 
4. Remind yourself of God‚Äôs Power ‚Äì Job 42:
a. When you are experiencing a deep trial the tendency is to think that what you‚Äôre going through will never end. 
i. When I look at how God blessed Job, Abraham, Joseph, David, Hannah, Naomi and a host of other Bible characters, I see both a God who took them through extended seasons of pain‚Ä¶
ii. But also‚Ä¶I see a God who was merciful, kind, patient, faithful and one who IN HIS TIME does not allow His children to suffer indefinitely and one who is merciful and faithful. You may have to meditate on these stories again and again to find strength to believe when you‚Äôve lost all hope. 

You lose a loved one. Your spouse cheats on you. You know God is in control which makes it worse. Why doesn‚Äôt He do something about this? Why did He let this happen?

title: How to Have a Killer Quiet Time with God
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Is your quiet time with God either missing, miserable or mysterious? Today I want to give you 6 tips on how to maximize your time with God. 

Hey everyone, Allen here and today I want to show you six things you can do to hopefully get the most out of your quiet time with God and they all start with the letter T. 

1. Talk ‚Äì Ps. 119:18 ‚Äì Before you open up the Bible to read it, ask God to show you what He wants you to see in the passage you‚Äôre reading. 

2. Time ‚Äì Pick a time that you are unhurried (meaning you can‚Äôt rush in and out of God‚Äôs presence and expect to have some grand connection) and uninterrupted (meaning you are completely and totally free from distraction ‚Äì NO PHONES). 

3. Type ‚Äì THIS IS HUGE! If you don‚Äôt do this what happens is you‚Äôll spend half of your time trying to figure out WHAT to read instead of actually reading. So let me give you a few suggestions. 
a. Topical (faith, fear, courage, spiritual gifts, etc.)
b. Character (David, Joseph, Esther, Hannah, Paul, etc.)
c. Book (Romans, Genesis) ‚Äì ‚ÄúHey for the next week or so I‚Äôm going to read and re-read the book of James.‚Äù (great book actually)
d. It doesn‚Äôt matter which one you do. Just PICK ONE! 

4. Tools ‚Äì 2 Tim. 2:15 says, ‚ÄúSTUDY to show yourself approved‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Äì If you‚Äôre going to graduate from reading the Bible to studying the Bible you need some tools to enhance your study. 
a. Study Bible ‚Äì Life Application ‚Äì filled with character profiles, lessons learned, concordance, etc.
b. Bible Dictionary ‚Äì Pharisee ‚Äì ‚ÄúWhat in the world is a Pharisee?‚Äù You grab your Bible dictionary and look up the word Pharisee and it will tell you everything you ever wanted to know about the Pharisees. Another tool that‚Äôs quite helpful is a concordance‚Ä¶
c. Concordance ‚Äì Let‚Äôs say you come across a Greek or Hebrew word that you want to know more about. You look that word up and it tells you how that word was used in that day. 
d. Commentary
e. Most of these you can access online for free. I‚Äôll put links in the description box below. 

5. Translation
a. Choose a translation that is EASY for you to understand. I‚Äôm always amazed at new Christians who start reading the King James Bible. Although that‚Äôs a great translation, it‚Äôs the most difficult to read because it was written in the 17th century and we don‚Äôt talk that way anymore.
b. So I recommend the NLT or the NIV. 

6. Transform ‚Äì The ultimate goal of Bible study is not information but transformation. So to help you apply the Bible I want to suggest 
a. 4 Questions (Command, Attitude, Sin, Example)
b. 4 Spheres (relationships, work, ministry, personal

title: What Does the Bible Say About Divorce and Remarriage?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr

BOOK ME TO SPEAK IN YOUR AREA HERE: http://www.allenparr.com/speaking/

TO DONATE TO THIS MINISTRY CLICK HERE: http://bit.ly/1TDPv2K
Links for YouTube Stuff

What does the Bible teach about divorce and remarriage? That‚Äôs our topic today on the BEAT.

Hey what‚Äôs up everyone my name is Allen Parr and so today we are dealing with a very sensitive subject. Statistics show that over 50% of all couples experience divorce, which means not only are they affected by it but their children are as well. I recognize there are a variety of views on it so my goal is to provide a balanced yet biblical view on the subject. 

With that being said, the first thing I want to say is that‚Ä¶

1. Divorce is not the unforgivable sin
a. I would argue that it‚Äôs not a sin at all in some situations. We‚Äôve taken this one sin and have shunned and shamed people and caused them to feel worse than they already do about the deep pain associated with a divorce. 
b. We need to be about the business of restoring people who are broken and reminding them that if God is big enough to forgive other sins then He is big enough to forgive the sin of divorce. 
2. Grounds for Divorce
a. With that being said I would argue that the Bible provides four grounds for divorce and remarriage.
b. Adultery ‚Äì Mt. 19:9 ‚Äì Jesus says that if a spouse commits adultery then the other spouse has the option to divorce and remarry although reconciliation is always preferred if the offending spouse is truly repentant. 
c. Abandonment ‚Äì 1 Cor. 7:12-15
d. Death ‚Äì 1 Cor. 7:39 ‚Äì Paul says that if a spouse dies then the living spouse is obviously no longer bound and is free to remarry.
e. Divorce as an Unbeliever ‚Äì 2 Cor. 5:17 ‚Äì When we become Christians God does not hold us accountable for anything we did before we were saved.
3. The X-Factor
a. With all of that being said I believe there is one x-factor here and that is the heart of God. I am convinced that, although there are consequences to our decisions, GOD ALWAYS RESPONDS TO A HEART OF REPENTANCE WITH GRACE.
b. We see this in the life of David. We see this with how God dealt with Israel who sinned against God repeatedly and yet God called them back to repentance. 
4. Finally my advice to someone who has experienced the devastating pain of divorce is
a. Go out of your way to shield your children from the pain of the divorce as much as you can.
b. But more importantly, NEVER WASTE A FAILURE! Take the lessons that you‚Äôve learned [see what part you played, if any, in the breakdown of the marriage] and turn around and help someone else because if you don‚Äôt you are allowing the enemy to get the victory on the front end and on the back end by causing you to hide behind your failures and being too ashamed to share your wisdom with someone else. 

If you found this video helpful‚Ä¶

title: The Four Needs Every Woman Desperately Wants Her Man to Meet
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
What are four needs your woman desperately wants you to meet? That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre going to talk about today. 

Hey what‚Äôs up everybody, welcome back. And so I want to look at just ONE verse and I believe this ONE verse teaches us how we as men can build a 4-sided fortress around our women so they feel totally and completely secure in our love. 

And so the first need is QUALITY TIME‚Ä¶
#1 ‚Äì ‚ÄúDwell with them‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Many men are task-oriented by nature so this doesn‚Äôt come natural for many of us but this involves‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Conversation that is unhurried and uninterrupted
‚Ä¢ Undistracted listener
‚Ä¢ Creative date nights
‚Ä¢ This means being intentional (you may have to actually schedule it) about carving out time and not giving away all of our time and energy to everyone and everything else that we are too drained to pour into our women.

The second is UNDERSTANDING. He goes on to say‚Ä¶
#2 ‚Äì ‚ÄúDwell with them in an understanding way‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Every woman wants a man who pays attention to her, understands her and studies her. 
‚Ä¢ What are her gifts? Dreams? Desires? Greatest fears? How is God working in her life? 
‚Ä¢ Taking a genuine interest in the things that matter to her the most even if they don‚Äôt matter to us.
‚Ä¢ This means listening to her more than talking about ourselves, our interests, accomplishments and successes and what matters to us. 
‚Ä¢ Paying attention to the things she likes.

The third is VALUE
#3 ‚Äì ‚ÄúDwell with them in an understanding way, giving honor to the wife‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Ä¢ The Greek word here literally means ‚Äúto assign precious value to‚Äù or to show ‚Äúpreference.‚Äù  
‚Ä¢ Think of it like fine china. We don‚Äôt treat it the same as regular dishware because it‚Äôs special.
‚Ä¢ And in the same way our women have a strong need to know that next to God she is the most important thing in your world. That she is more important than work, school, ministry, your friends, business pursuits, your hobbies, etc. If not she can quickly become insecure and feel as though she is competing for your attention. in the relationship. 

The fourth is PROTECTION
#4 ‚Äì ‚ÄúDwell with them in an understanding way, giving honor to the wife as to the weaker vessel‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Notice here that it doesn‚Äôt say she is weaker but Peter instructs us to deal with her as if she was the weaker vessel (this word refers primarily to physical strength)
‚Ä¢ Women in many ways are stronger than men. They live longer. They often times have a higher threshold of pain than we do (they deal with it every month. We‚Äôre big babies). 
‚Ä¢ But underneath that strength she has a strong, strong need to be totally protected and to have a safe place where she doesn‚Äôt NEED to be strong. 
‚Ä¢ This involves her need to feel physically protected, financially, and most importantly, emotionally safe which means we must create an environment where she feels safe to express her deepest regrets, failures, insecurities and fears without fear of being judged. 

Notice also that Peter adds a motivation here. He says, ‚Äúso that our prayers won‚Äôt be hindered.‚Äù So God says, ‚Äúwhy would I give you what you‚Äôre asking Me for if I know it‚Äôs only going to take you further away from loving and honoring the gift I‚Äôve given you?‚Äù So perhaps when we put her love on top the breakthrough that we‚Äôve been praying for will come to pass. 

So men, I confess that these are things I‚Äôm learning every day about being a husband. So, I want to encourage us to meditate on this verse and let‚Äôs build a 4-sided fortress around our women that involves quality time, understanding, honor and protection that is so secure she doesn‚Äôt want to get out and predators can‚Äôt get in.

title: The Back Story About How We Really Got Our Bible!
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
How can we be sure that the 66 books that we call the Bible truly is the word of God?

Hey what‚Äôs up everyone, so one of the most common questions about the Bible is how did we get the Bible we have today? Why 66 books and were there any that were somehow lost or left out? So I hope to answer these questions in this video. 

KEY #1 ‚Äì The church DISCOVERED not DETERMINED which books were inspired. The church leaders merely recognized through a process which ones were already inspired and which ones were not. 

Now the question becomes, what was this process that they used to discover which books were inspired and which ones were not. 
1. What did Jesus say about this book?
a. By the time Jesus was born the Jewish community had already accepted 39 books as being inspired by God. 
i. Jesus affirmed it
ii. Jesus quoted from it
iii. Jesus referenced people from it
iv. Jesus taught from it
2. Was it written by an accepted prophet, apostle or someone closely connected to an apostle?
a. Why was this important? Because prophets and apostles were accredited with miraculous signs, wonders and miracles. So, if they were endowed with the power of God that made their writings credible. 
b. Jesus had predicted in John 17:20 that people would believe THROUGH THEIR MESSAGE!
c. Always many of them were eyewitnesses to what they were writing about (scripture)
3. Does this book tell the truth about God and is it consistent with the other teachings that we KNOW are inspired?
a. During the first few centuries there were lots of writings and not all of them were inspired by God. 
b. An example of such a book that was the Gospel of Thomas where it says, ‚ÄúSimon Peter said to them: ‚ÄòLet Mary go away from us, for women are not worthy of life.‚Äô Jesus said: ‚ÄòLo, I shall lead her, so that I may make her a male, that she too may become a living spirit, resembling you males. For every woman who makes herself a male will enter the kingdom of heaven.‚Äù
c. So clearly this book did not tell the truth about Jesus and is inconsistent with other scriptures and so they threw this one out and discovered this book was not inspired by God. 
4. Was the book accepted by the early church as being authoritative? Was it used in the church? Did church leaders preach from this book? 
5. Does this book carry with it the power of God? In other words, they asked, ‚Äúwhen we read this book do we get a sense that it was written by God with the ability to transform lives?

Finally, just like it takes faith to trust in a God you‚Äôve never physically seen, it takes faith to trust that if God was powerful enough to write His word through flawed and fallible men, He is also strong enough to preserve it and oversee and govern the process by which His word came together. And we trust that God would not have us to live and govern our lives by something that did not correctly reflect who He is.

title: The Shocking Truth About the Gift of Speaking in Tongues
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
THE SHOCKING TRUTH ABOUT TONGUES

What does the Bible teach about this gift of speaking in tongues? That‚Äôs what we are going to talk about today on the BEAT.
Hey what‚Äôs up everyone my name is Allen Parr and so today we are tackling the touchy subject of speaking in tongues. What is the gift of tongues? What are some misconceptions of tongues? How should it be used in the church?

What is the Gift of Tongues?

1) The gift of tongues originally was the supernatural ability to share the gospel in another known dialect without the speaker having previous knowledge of this language (like me speaking Japanese) ‚Äì Acts 2:1-12
2) Some also believe it is the ability to speak and/or pray in an unknown language.

So What are some of the Misconceptions?

1) Everyone can learn to speak in tongues ‚Äì The Bible teaches that tongues is a spiritual gift. It also teaches that the Holy Spirit is the one who distributes spiritual gifts to believers AS HE WILLS. So just like any other gift you cannot choose your gifts they are given to you. So I don‚Äôt how a Christian can learn to speak in tongues any more than they can learn to possess the gift of pastoring of healing or miracles. 
2) The second misconception is‚Ä¶People who speak in tongues have more spiritual power than those that don‚Äôt ‚Äì I don‚Äôt see anywhere in Scripture where a person who spoke/prayed in tongues was able to accomplish more spiritually than those that didn‚Äôt. 
a. This type of mentality merely divides the church more than it already is into the haves and the have-nots and makes those that don‚Äôt have the gift feel inferior. 


How should this Gift be used in the Church?

1) There must be an interpreter ‚Äì So if you‚Äôre in church and everyone is speaking in tongues Paul says, what if someone who isn‚Äôt familiar with the gift or an unbeliever comes in? (Put yourself in their shoes) They will think they‚Äôve just entered into a crazy place.  (14:23) So the question is, ‚ÄúWhy would you want to take a chance of offending, confusing or turning off an unbeliever from church simply because you feel the need to speak/pray in tongues in church?‚Äù Which is why Paul said, ‚ÄúI CAN speak in tongues but IN CHURCH I would rather speak in a language that EVERYONE can understand.‚Äù  So even Paul said he doesn‚Äôt speak in tongues in church unless there is a KNOWN interpreter present. 
2) Experience should never contradict Scripture ‚Äì Sometimes people will say, ‚Äúwell I just felt the Spirit.‚Äù Saints, the same Spirit who empowers us to use our gifts is the same Spirit who inspired the writing of the Bible and He cannot contradict Himself by leading you to have an experience in church that goes against the writing of Scripture. 


Finally, because a Christian‚Äôs view on this subject has nothing to do with salvation.

It is my prayer that your views and experiences with this will be based on scripture
Always remember to be sensitive to unbelievers when in a church‚Ä¶

Finally, be careful not to adopt the mentality that people who have the gift are more spiritual or more powerful than those that don‚Äôt. 

I would love to know your experience with this as it relates to the church so please leave your comments below I‚Äôd love to hear them. 

We should be focused more on exemplifying the fruit of the Spirit than we are with the gifts of the Spirit.

title: What to Do when you Feel Disconnected from God
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
What do you do when you feel disconnected, distant from God and you feel as though you‚Äôve lost your passion for God and your spiritual life just feels stagnant? Stick around and find out the solution. 

Hey welcome back everyone my name is Allen Parr and I am SO EXCITED about our word today. Every so often it‚Äôs normal to feel disconnected from God so I want to look at two verses today and give you four steps you can take to reestablish that intimacy with God. The author uses the imagery of a runner who is trying to reach a goal. I am excited about our word today! Everything we need to know in order to restore out intimacy can be found in these two verses right here. 

1. Lay aside the WEIGHT ‚Äì ‚ÄúLet us strip off every weight that slows us down‚Äù
a. Normally something that is innocent and harmless but it‚Äôs something that consistently diverts our attention, drains you of your energy and hinders us from developing intimacy with God. 
b. It could be a particular PERSON or PEOPLE
c. Busyness ‚Äì Your schedule is so filled with activities. And if you‚Äôre serving in ministry in any capacity the danger is to confuse activity for intimacy. Duty NEVER replaces Devotion. 
d. Disappointment with God and that is blocking your intimacy with Him
e. Career, overtime, etc. 
f. Social Media
2. Eliminate the SIN ‚Äì ‚Äú‚Ä¶especially the sin that so easily trips us up.‚Äù 
a. When you and I have some perpetual sin that is reoccurring in our lives it creates GUILT and GUILT creates separation from God. And then you have to break through your own guilt and conviction to try to reestablish that connection with God. But it‚Äôs difficult when you find yourself caught in the cycle of sin and confession. 
b. So identify that sin and truly repent of it so you can experience intimacy with God.
3. Walk in PURPOSE ‚Äì ‚ÄúAnd let us run the race‚Ä¶God has marked out for us.‚Äù
a. One of the reasons why you are feeling disconnected is because God has a specific purpose or race He intended for you to run. And when you are not running that race it creates an unrest within you because you‚Äôre doing one thing but deep within you know you should be doing something else which leads to feeling disconnected. Let me give you a few questions I encourage you to ask yourself if you are trying to find your purpose. 
i. What negative experiences has God allowed in your life that God can recycle to help others?
ii. What do you see wrong that you long to make right?
iii. What gift(s) have other people consistently affirmed in your life? 
b. So I encourage you to figure out what your God-given purpose is and walk in it!
4. Focus on JESUS ‚Äì ‚ÄúWe do this by keeping our eyes on Jesus.‚Äù 
a. Do the things that foster intimacy (consistent quiet time). Remember, good Christians meet with God when they can; they fit it in when they can. Great Christians meet with God at a set time every day. 
b. There is NO short cut to intimacy. If you want it you must be willing to put in the work and time. 

So if you‚Äôre struggling to feel connected with God be encouraged. I‚Äôve been there so many times in my own personal walk and so have so many others. But the good news is that just like in any relationship if you‚Äôve ever experienced intimacy with God you can get it back by following these 4 simple steps.
