title: Should Couples Live Together before Marriage?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

Should Couples Live together before Marriage?

Living together before marriage, which includes what I call ‚Äúslick shacking‚Äù, is becoming more and more popular as our society becomes more and more skeptical of the institution of marriage.  

And so as a result this has led many people including relationship experts to believe that living together before marriage gives the couple the opportunity to ‚Äútry it before you buy it‚Äù so to speak. But, does it really work? 

Interestingly the statistics prove otherwise

1. Statistical - Dozens of SECULAR studies have been performed between the 1970s and early 2000s where thousands of couples were carefully observed and they all consistently report the following.
a. One study showed that couples that live together before marriage have a 46% higher likelihood of separating than those who wait to get married. 
b. Another study showed that only 60% of couples who live together before marriage will actually get married. And of the remaining 40% who do, 5 out 6 of them will be divorced within 3 years. 
c. Higher level of adultery
d. Finally studies show that there is a lower level of sexual satisfaction in their marriages

BUT, the real question that we MUST answer is WHY when it makes so much logical sense to live together (test drive, try before you buy it, etc.) before marriage? One of the reasons why there is a higher likelihood that the relationship will end in divorce is‚Ä¶

2. Sociological
a. Often times a man sees moving in as a more convenient way to get sex and an opportunity to test out the relationship. Whereas women tend to see it as the next step towards marriage. And what happens is over time the couple has made such an investment financially and emotionally that it‚Äôs harder to get out than they think and so the couple ends up ‚Äúsliding, not deciding‚Äù into marriage.
b. A second reason is that often times the people who move in together are generally the type of people who have a lower view of the institution of marriage as a whole (SCREEN: ‚ÄúI mean it‚Äôs just a piece of paper‚Äù) which means they may be more likely to bail when the relationship goes through difficult times.
c. Finally, couples that live together are entering into marriage with a different foundation than those that don‚Äôt. 
 
3. Spiritual ‚Äì What does the Bible have to say about this topic? Well, it really doesn‚Äôt say anything directly related to the topic but like many other things there are principles that should guide our decision.
a. Do not be conformed to the world ‚Äì So when we live together we are living and acting just like the world. 
b. Not put ourselves in situations that are sexually tempting ‚Äì Flee immorality (grk. be a fugitive)
c. Avoid the very appearance of evil ‚Äì 1 Thess. (see also Eph. 5:3) ‚Äì So even if you are living together and not having sex it will appear to those looking on that you actually are. 
d. Which leads to the final reason why it‚Äôs not a good idea and that is the fact that you are sending the message to the world that it is okay to have sex before marriage whether you are or aren‚Äôt which could cause others to follow your behavior and stumble into sin.

title: What to do When you're Worried about Money!
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
What do you do when you‚Äôre worried about MONEY?

Hey what‚Äôs up everyone, my name is Allen Parr and today we are talking about what to do when we are worried about our money and so I want to give you 4 practical steps to apply and the first is to‚Ä¶

1. Check your priorities
a. There is a beautiful passage of scripture in the book of Haggai (the book is only one chapter‚Ä¶please read) where God says, ‚ÄúI want you to think about what is happening around you. You‚Äôre planting so much but you‚Äôre not seeing much in return. And the reason he says is because all of y‚Äôall are living in these luxurious homes while the temple you were supposed to build for me lies in ruins (nice home vs. ruined home on screen).  
b. IMPLICATION: You are SO concerned about pushing your agenda forward that my priorities continue to lie on the back-burner. 
c. Two things that happen when we don‚Äôt put God first
i. So God says, ‚ÄúI have a way of making the money you bring in fall through the holes in your pants. 
ii. He even says, ‚Äúwhatever you bring in I‚Äôm going to blow it away.‚Äù Then He says‚Ä¶
iii. There are some blessings that I want to release in your life but I‚Äôm going to withhold them until you make my agenda a priority in your life. 
d. It so it could very well be that God desperately wants you to put Him first in some area of your life and He‚Äôs using this frustration with your finances to get your attention (see also Mt. 6:33).
2. Assess what you CAN control
a. This one is huge. Many of us are worried about money when our mismanagement of it is the source of our own stress. 
b. Paul said, we are supposed to be content ‚Äúwith food and clothing we should be content.‚Äù 
i. BUDGET: (Prov. 27:23-24 ‚Äì SCREEN) ‚Äì So I want to I challenge you if you are stressed out about your finances to look closely at your current budget and you may find a few hundred dollars each month that you can save that will relieve some of the financial stress you are under. 
ii. Secondly, we as Christians love to say, ‚Äúwell I‚Äôm just trusting God for my finances.‚Äù 
iii. SECOND JOB: But the same Bible says ‚Äúfaith without works is dead.‚Äù In other words, it‚Äôs more than just trusting God. You may have to work a second job in order to relieve ourselves from some of the stress that we‚Äôre under. 
iv. The Bible has a lot of positive things to say about work and a lot of negative things to say about laziness.
c. And so I love to think of it this way, ‚Äúwork as if everything depended on you and trust as if everything depended upon God.‚Äù 

3. Stop worrying & Trust God ‚Äì It‚Äôs been said that ‚Äúworrying pulls tomorrow‚Äôs cloud over today‚Äôs sunshine.‚Äù Jesus had a lot to say about this subject in Matt. 6 so I want to give you 6 quick facts about worrying.  , ‚Äú 
a. Statistics prove that over 90% of what we worry about never comes to pass. 
b. Wastes time
c. Unproductive
d. Adds tension to your relationships
e. Hinders you from enjoying life as God intended
f. Leads to more worrying and stress

So my encouragement to you is to stay present and resist the temptation to allow the enemy to steal your joy and wreak havoc in your mind with the proverbial what if game.

4. Accept your financial difficulty as a tool God uses to develop your faith
a. Jesus said, ‚ÄúIn this life you WILL have trouble.
b. Peter said, ‚ÄúStop being surprised when these difficulties come because Christians all over the world are experiencing the same troubles.‚Äù
c. And James said, ‚ÄúGod is using this difficulty to develop perseverance in your life.
d. And so if you‚Äôre struggling with your finances today, you‚Äôre stressed out and frustrated, just know that God may be using this difficulty in your life to elevate your faith from middle school faith to high school faith so that the next time these difficulties come you will be able to look back and see how faithful God was in your past which will give you the confidence you need to know that if He‚Äôs done it in the past He‚Äôll do it again. 
SCREEN: Worry has been described as ‚Äúa thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged, it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained‚Äù 

If you enjoyed this video please share it with a friend. Also feel free to check out some of my other videos on my YouTube channel and subscribe it you like them. Thank you so much for watching!

title: Is Drinking Alcohol a Sin?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Is drinking alcohol a sin? That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre going to talk about today. 

Alright so this question comes up ALL the time. ‚ÄúIs it a sin to drink alcohol?‚Äù To answer this question people tend to go to one of two extremes. Either they will say, ‚ÄúA Christian should not drink wine under ANY circumstances.‚Äù Or they will say, ‚Äúit‚Äôs not a sin; I can drink as much as I want as long as I don‚Äôt get drunk.‚Äù But what does the Bible have to say about this? 

The quick answer to that is NO. (SCREEN: Wine is like money: Neither are inherently evil but it‚Äôs how you use it or abuse it that matters)

Interestingly enough the Bible has a lot of positive things to say about the use of wine. 

1. Celebration ‚Äì Jesus drank wine with His disciples but He made wine from scratch ‚Äì Mt. 11:19; Lk. 7:34 ‚Äì So if it‚Äôs a sin then Jesus sinned and caused a whole bunch of other people to sin. (they actually accused Him of being a drunkard)
2. Enjoyment ‚Äì Wine was created by God simply to be enjoyed ‚Äì Eccl. 9:7 (read with emphasis)
3. Wine was used for communion (represents Jesus‚Äô blood ‚Äì some use grape juice others use actual wine) ‚Äì (see 1 Cor. 11:21) ‚Äì So if it was a sin that means we could potentially sin each time we take communion. 

BUT, there are times when it may not be wise to drink. The Bible says, ‚ÄúAll things are permitted but not all things are profitable. Let me suggest to you 3 questions to ask yourself before you drink. 

1 Cor. ‚ÄúAll things are permitted but not all things are profitable.‚Äù 

1. Will this damage my Christian image? 
a. Non-believers ‚Äì 1 Pet. 2:12 ‚Äì ‚ÄúBe careful to live properly among your unbelieving neighbors‚Ä¶‚Äù Could my drinking in public cause other non-Christians to get the wrong impression about my lifestyle? People are looking for any reason to say, ‚ÄúYou Christians are hypocritical! There‚Äôs no difference between you and me!‚Äù And so‚Ä¶
b. Even though you are drinking in moderation it could be perceived that you are getting drunk which sends the message that you are no better than them. 
c. We must always be aware that we are a representation of Christ and Christianity 
2. Will this encourage someone else to sin? Paul says in 1 Cor. 8:13, ‚ÄúI know I have the personal freedom to eat meat. But if I‚Äôm around someone who‚Äôs conscience convicts them about eating meat then out of respect for them I‚Äôll refrain from eating meat.‚Äù 
a. Let‚Äôs say you‚Äôre out with your friends‚Ä¶
b. Believers ‚Äì Could believers who look to me for their example stumble into sin? You‚Äôd be surprised how many people look up to us and pattern their lives after watching ours. 1 Cor. 8. Let‚Äôs say you‚Äôre at a party and you‚Äôre drinking and someone with you who used to struggle with alcohol sees you drinking a lot. Because they look up to you they will see that as acceptable behavior and then may end up drinking too much because it‚Äôs a struggle for them. So out of respect for them, you refrain from drinking in that situation. 
c. Are you causing someone else to stumble because they are watching you?
3. Is this becoming an addiction? ‚Äú‚Ä¶even though I am allowed to do anything I will not become a slave to anything.‚Äù (explain this‚Ä¶)
a. But‚Ä¶when you get to the point where you can‚Äôt go very long without it‚Ä¶
b. Every time you go out you HAVE to have that wine or that beer‚Ä¶
c. You start to use this as a way of escape‚Ä¶It could be the early signs of an addiction.  
d. (If you can‚Äôt drink in moderation it destroys blood vessels and brain cells.) 

So, can a Christian drink alcohol? The quick answer to this question is NO! There is no scripture in the Bible that prohibits drinking but it does teach that getting drunk is a sin (Eph. 5:18). These questions can be applied to a list of questionable activities. Use wisdom as to when you should or shouldn‚Äôt drink.

title: How to Change Someone's Life Forever
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

How many people's lives will be changed forever because they met you? Today I want to show you exactly how you can have that kind of impact on someone‚Äôs life.  

Hey what‚Äôs up everyone welcome back my name is Allen Parr and we are often told that as Christians we are to make disciples (SCREEN: Mt 28:19-20). But we are seldom told how to do it. So today I want to share with you 4 principles on how to make a lifelong impact in someone else‚Äôs life.  And the first principle is‚Ä¶

#1 ‚Äì Intentionality ‚Äì Jesus was intentional about selecting the men and women He wanted to pour Himself into. He invited them rather than waiting for them to ask Him. In the same way‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Be intentional about finding some people to reproduce yourself into‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Make sure they want to be discipled and they see the long-term value in it and they are appreciative of the opportunity to be discipled by you. Faithful and one day will reproduce themselves in other people
‚Ä¢ If you aren‚Äôt intentional then it will seldom happen

#2 ‚Äì Time ‚Äì This is probably the main hindrance to people making disciples is that it takes ‚Äútoo much time.‚Äù 
‚Ä¢ Jesus spent over 3 years pouring Himself into 12 men. And as a result after He died these 12 men singlehandedly changed the world. 
‚Ä¢ A wise person said if you want to IMPRESS people spend little time with them. If you want to INFLUENCE them spend more time with them. But if you want to IMPACT them spend much time with them. 
‚Ä¢ Over TIME you‚Äôll develop their TRUST and once you develop their TRUST you‚Äôll then be able to share TRUTH with them. Once you get to this stage your not just filling their HEAD (how they think) with knowledge you‚Äôre impacting their HEART (how they believe) and their HANDS (how they live). 
‚Ä¢ SCREEN: One of the best ways to do this is to simply take them along with you to different places that you are already going. 
o This will allow them to observe you
o It will allow you to observe them
o Provide teachable moments along the way

#3 ‚Äì Teaching ‚Äì Not only did Jesus invest time into his 12 disciples but he taught them while spending time with them. John 17:8

There are several ways you can do this.
‚Ä¢ Go through a book of the Bible

But if you‚Äôre not confident in leading someone through a book of the Bible‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Read a Christian book together and meet each week to discuss it
‚Ä¢ You can share with them wisdom from your own personal experience (but this introduces the principles of TRANSPARENCY)
‚Ä¢ Find interesting articles online for them to read and discuss together

Don‚Äôt worry about what you don‚Äôt know. Simply teach them what you do know.

#4 ‚Äì Integrity ‚Äì Jesus‚Äô disciples followed Him because He modeled everything He was asking them to do (prayer, teaching, Bible study, serving others, etc.) ‚Äì Nothing will destroy a discipleship relationship quicker than a lack of integrity. The people God has given you are looking up to you as their example (Eph. 5:1). (SCREEN: We will reproduce what we are). 

CLOSING
People will forget a sermon and a song but when you have this type of impact on their life they will remember you for a lifetime and then they will then be able to later reproduce themselves in someone else all because you were willing to invest a little of your time.  Never forget that by investing some of your time into even just one person you are making a impact on eternity.

title: Career vs Calling: What's the Difference?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Career vs. Calling: What‚Äôs the Difference?

Do you have a career or a calling? What‚Äôs the difference? That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre going to talk about today. 

I want to talk today about the difference between a career and a calling because a lot of people are very confused about this. And I hear people say ‚Äúmy calling is to be an artist‚Äù or ‚Äúa musician‚Äù or a ‚Äúdoctor.‚Äù They are mistaking what could be a hobby, passion, talent, side hustle or career for a calling. And so first I want to highlight some differences between the two. Then give some biblical examples of a calling. Finally I want to provide a clear biblical definition of a calling. 

#1 ‚Äì Differences between a Career and a Calling
CAREER VS. CALLING
CAREER CALLING
Natural talents Spiritual Gifts
Please your employer Please your God
CAN do MUST do
Changes Doesn‚Äôt Change
Benefits for this life ONLY Benefits for Eternity
Advance the company Advance the kingdom of God


Fulfillment that does not compare to your career

#2 ‚Äì Examples of Careers & Callings

Jesus was a carpenter ‚Äì Career ‚Äì Calling was to be the Savior of the world
Paul was a tentmaker ‚Äì Career ‚Äì Calling was to be an apostle to the Gentiles
Disciples were fishermen ‚Äì Career ‚Äì Calling was to be ‚Äúfishers of men.‚Äù 
Matthew was a tax collector ‚Äì Career ‚Äì Calling was to be a disciple of Jesus

All of these men used the resources from their careers to support themselves and others. And even though their careers took up a considerable amount of their time they stayed focused and never lost sight of what they knew God had created them to do. 

#3 ‚Äì What is a calling?
So what exactly is a calling? A calling is not always some mystical thing that God reveals to only a select few people. 

Jesus made it very clear that every Christian has the same calling. He said, ‚ÄúGo‚Ä¶make disciples‚Ä¶baptize‚Ä¶teach‚Ä¶‚Äù If you are not going, making disciples, baptizing (new Christians) and teaching people how to obey God‚Äôs commands then it may be a hobby, a passion, a talent, side gig/hustle but I hesitate to call it a calling. 

Anything that an unbeliever can do just as well as a believer can‚Äôt be considered a calling. Because if God‚Äôs main focus is to advance His kingdom then why would God call you to advance something else? 

KEY QUESTION: How does what I do for my calling DIRECTLY IMPACT the advancement of God‚Äôs kingdom?

If you can‚Äôt answer that question, then I would hesitate to label it as a calling. 

This is a very controversial and subjective topic so I would love to hear your thoughts on this subject so please leave them in the comments section, tag your friends and invite them to join in the discussion as well and let‚Äôs talk about it. If you are struggling to find your specific purpose/calling I encourage you to head over to my blog where I give 7 questions you can ask yourself to discover your specific purpose. I‚Äôll put the link below.
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr

Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

title: What is the Purpose of Fasting?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

What is the purpose of fasting? That's what we are going to talk about today.

Hey everyone welcome back my name is Allen Parr and today I want to ask and answer three questions‚Ä¶
Read Isaiah 58:1-9 (3 times in the video)
1. What is fasting? (sum (hbr) means ‚Äúto cover‚Äù the mouth and nestuo (grk) means ‚Äúto abstain‚Äù)
a. Fasting is when we voluntarily (the Bible doesn‚Äôt command it) choose to sacrifice something of value for the purpose of seeking God with more intensity. 
b. Usually it‚Äôs food because for most people food is the most difficult thing to give up. However, if food is not it for you (e.g. sex (in marriage), social media, entertainment, etc.)) then you may want to fast from food and something else that you know would be a sacrifice to give up (put some on the screen) and instead dedicate that time to God. 
2. Why should we fast? (many of the great saints in the Bible practiced fasting (Paul, David, Elijah, Jesus, Moses, Esther, etc.)
a. Major Decision ‚Äì To petition God for direction before making a major decision (Judges 20:26; Acts 14:23)
b. Personal Revival ‚Äì To rekindle your passion for God and experience personal revival
c. Spiritual Strength ‚Äì When people in the Bible fasted they felt spiritually stronger after the fast (Mt. 4; 17) (If you can‚Äôt overcome the power of your belly how can you overcome the power of a demon?)
d. Health benefits (longer life, resistance to diabetes and other illnesses)
e. Spiritual leaders encourage it (repentance, mourning, spiritual revival)
3. How should we fast?
a. Privately ‚Äì Mt. 6: - Jesus says when you fast don‚Äôt walk around with a long face because you‚Äôre so hungry in hopes of someone asking you why you‚Äôre hungry. 
b. Regularly ‚Äì (Luke 2:37) ‚Äì Fasting is not meant to be done once at the beginning of the year and never again. It is supposed to be an ongoing part of your Christian life like prayer and Bible study. 
c. Intimately ‚Äì In other words, don‚Äôt focus so much on what you‚Äôre giving up (that‚Äôs called a diet vs. fasting) instead focus on developing intimacy with God as a replacement but rather focus on putting your attention completely and totally upon God. 

One of the greatest benefits of fasting is that it exposes the idolatry in your life. When you fast if all you can think about is what you‚Äôre giving up instead of focusing on God, it could be that is an idol in your life.

title: How to Have More Faith
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

Do you want to have the type of faith that releases God‚Äôs fullest blessings on your life? That's what we're going to talk about today on the BEAT.

Hey what‚Äôs up everybody welcome back my name is Allen Parr and today we are talking about how to increase your faith. Our story today comes from Numbers 13 where Moses had sent 12 men to explore this land that God had already promised to give them. 10 out of the 12 came back and said, ‚ÄúThe land is too FORITIFIED the people are like GIANTS in the land. There‚Äôs NO WAY that we can get that land!‚Äù But 2 of them said, ‚ÄúThe land is OURS!‚Äù Today I want to share with you the secret to increasing your faith. And the first is‚Ä¶

1. REMEMBER God‚Äôs PAST faithfulness
a. God had done some AMAZING things in their past (Red Sea, water from the rock, clothes & shoes grew) (SCREEN: manna, battle victories, etc.). Had they had just remembered what God had done for them in the past it would have given them the confidence to trust God in the present.
b. So the next time your faith is tested go back and recount all of the times in your past when your back was up against the wall and your faith was tested and God delivered right on time (which is why you should write them down and keep a log. If you don‚Äôt do this you will yourself working yourself up into a frenzy every single time your faith is tested which could be every day.) 

The second thing we need to do if we want to see our faith increase is to‚Ä¶

2. REJECT the thinking of negative PEOPLE
a. Notice here in verse 32 it says that these 10 spies ‚Äúand they spread among the Israelites a bad report about the land they had explored‚Ä¶‚Äù As a result the whole nation of 2 million Jews were filled with fear instead of faith. Why? Because they allowed themselves to be influenced by the 10 spies that had no faith rather than the 2 that did.
b. In the same way, if you surround yourself with people are who negative and struggle to trust God and have very few testimonies of seeing God‚Äôs power work in their lives, that negative thinking will influence you to live in fear rather than faith and you‚Äôll miss out on what God had already intended to give you. 
c. Instead, surround yourself with people who are where you believe you want to be. And let their contagious faith rub off on you and influence you to live in faith rather than fear. 

The third and final thing we need to do to increase our faith is to‚Ä¶

3. RECOGNIZE God‚Äôs POWER
a. Notice here that the 10 NEGATIVE spies said, ‚ÄúWE can‚Äôt attack those people, they are stronger than WE are‚Ä¶‚Äù 
b. But the 2 POSITIVE spies said, ‚ÄúIf the LORD is pleased with us, HE will lead us into that land‚Ä¶and HE will give it to us.‚Äù 
c. Many of us are like the first group of spies who only considered what THEY could do and totally disregarded God‚Äôs POWER. 
d. And when you fail to recognize God‚Äôs power you will always struggle with your faith because in many situations your resources, your intelligence, your abilities, your influence and your connections will not be enough and you forget that God is involved and invested in our lives and has power beyond what we could imagine! 

Now as a result the Bible says that this generation of Israelites did not receive the blessing of the Promised Land that God intended for them to receive because they had no faith. And in the same way as we transition into a new season there may be some blessings (opportunities, open doors, etc.) that God wants to release in your life and the only key that will unlock them is faith. So I want to encourage you to remember God‚Äôs past faithfulness in your life, reject the thinking of negative people and recognize God‚Äôs power and that you are not in your situation by yourself.

title: Is Jesus the only Way?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

HOOK: Is believing in Jesus Christ the ONLY way to get to God? (You may need to know the answer to this or you are wondering yourself. That stats are in. 56% of all professing Christians believe there is another way to get to heaven other than Jesus. 
I mean you have Judaism, Islam, Hinduism, Buddhism, JW‚Äôs Mormons to name a few. So how can Jesus and Christianity be the ONLY way? Today I want to share with you 4 things that totally set him apart from every other religious leader that has ever lived. 

1. Power ‚Äì No other religious leader DID what He DID
a. Miracles, Resurrections, raised Himself from the dead, He walked on water (even the Holy Qu‚Äôran mentions Jesus‚Äô miracles)
b. The greatest miracle in the history of time is His own resurrection 3 days after He was crucified in which He showed Himself alive to over 500 people as proof that the resurrection indeed was an actual historical event (add scripture).
c. Jesus Himself said, ‚Äúif you don‚Äôt believe in my message then fine. But at least believe in the works that I do.‚Äù In other words, Jesus didn‚Äôt just say He was the only way He backed it up by doing things that no other religious leader has ever done. Not only did Jesus raise Himself from the dead but He prophesied He was going to do it beforehand which leads me to my second reason‚Ä¶
2. Prophecies ‚Äì No other religious leader FULFILLED prophecy
a. He was the only religious leader who was able to fulfill prophecies written about Him hundreds of years before He came to the earth ‚Äì No other leader can boast of that (the odds of 1 man fulfilling 8 prophecies in a lifetime is 1 x 10^17). Virgin birth, prophecies about the exact date when Jesus would die and exactly how He would die. And Jesus fulfilled these prophecies and many others with perfect accuracy.  
3. Preaching/Message ‚Äì No other religious leader TAUGHT what He TAUGHT
a. Jesus is the only religious leader who provided a genuine solution for the problem of sin. 
b. Every other religious leader teaches that you must DO something in order to earn salvation & forgiveness which puts you in a very insecure and uncertain state because you never really know if you‚Äôve done enough righteous works to earn God‚Äôs favor. 
c. Jesus teaches that He‚Äôs already done the work for you. All you have to do is to BELIEVE one thing and you are saved. 
d. All nine of the founders of religions except Jesus admit to going through a period of uncertainty where they were searching for truth and enlightenment. 
4. Perfection ‚Äì No other religious leader LIVED how He LIVED
a. Some of the other religious leaders even to their own admission led very sinful lives. Some of them were polygamists, others were murderers, some of them made countless prophecies that never came to pass. But Jesus is the only religious leader who lived a sinless perfect life even to the point where the very people who crucified Him admitted that they could find no fault in Him. 
i. Jesus (Jn. 8:46), His followers (Heb. 4:15) and His enemies (John 19:6) all asserted His perfect life
b. Mohammad confessed his sin and was a man like us ‚Äì Surah 18:110 ‚Äì Killed many people who disagreed with him. (also said majority of people in hell would be women)
c. Siddhartha Gautama, founder of Buddhism abandoned his wife and son to achieve ‚Äúenlightenment.‚Äù 
d. Joseph Smith the founder of Mormonism made prophecies and claims that never came to pass making him a liar and supported polygamy and took on extra wives. 

Now for the Christian who says that there is another way to heaven besides Jesus you are saying that the Bible is false (Acts 4:12) and Jesus was a liar (John 14:6) because He said very clearly that He was THE way, THE truth and THE life and that NO ONE can come to the Father except through Him.

title: How to Practice Patience
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

Do you struggle with patience? If you‚Äôre anything like me you can‚Äôt stand waiting in traffic. I can‚Äôt stand waiting for people to change and most of all I can‚Äôt stand waiting on God to do something in my life. And yet over and over again in the Bible we are encouraged to WAIT! And so today we are going to talk about what it looks like to be patient. 

Hey everyone welcome back my name is Allen Parr and today we are talking about patience. Now we all know we should be patient at all times but I believe there are 3 specific times in our lives where we need an extra dose of patience and in James 5:7-12 he gives us 3 illustrations to help us better understand patience. 

1. Patience with your Circumstances
a. ILLUSTRATION: For this first illustration James uses the example of a farmer. This refers to being PATIENT WITH YOUR CIRCUMSTANCES. A farmer as we know has no control over whether or not it‚Äôs going to rain, the amount of sunshine, whether or not people will buy their crops or not and yet they still have to plant seeds. 
b. GREEK WORD: Wait ‚Äì ‚Äúto look with anticipation‚Äù ‚Äì The reason why a farmer could be patient is because of how faithful God had been in their past. Even though it may take longer than expected a farmer can look back and see that God was faithful to send rain each year.
c. In the same way‚Ä¶
d. EXAMPLES:
i. Unemployment ‚Äì continue to fill out applications and submit resumes 
ii. Business growth/Ministry growth
iii. Promotion on your job ‚Äì continue to plant seeds
e. These are all situations that you have absolutely NO control over and yet you have to keep sowing seeds in anticipation that one day your situation will change. 
f. And so in the same way we can be patient and continue to plant seeds 

The second illustration James uses is that of a prophet and this refers primarily with being‚Ä¶
2. Patience with PEOPLE
a. Prophets ‚Äì They had to continue to share God‚Äôs word with stiff-necked stubborn people who refused to change year after year. 
b. The Greek word he uses here is the word Macrothumeo
c. Perhaps God has placed some people in your life that refuse to change. (family member, spouse, a child, a boss or coworker). 
d. No matter what you do this person refuses to change. You have clearly shown them what they need to do and the route they need to take and yet they refuse to change. You‚Äôve shared God‚Äôs truth with them. It‚Äôs clear to you what they need to do and yet they can‚Äôt see what you see. For whatever reason they aren‚Äôt changing as fast as you would expect them to. This is the second time when we need to make sure we are being patient. 

The third illustration James uses is from the life of Job and this refers primarily to being patient when your PAIN IS UNEXPLAINABLE
3. Patience with God
a. Job ‚Äì Lost everything, health, wealth and his family and to his knowledge there was no apparent reason for why he was experiencing this pain. 
b. Hupomeno 
c. You can‚Äôt figure out WHY you are experiencing the pain that you‚Äôre going through
i. Physical illness
ii. Unemployed
iii. Loved one who is sick
iv. Spouse who is mistreating you
d. When we read the story of Job we notice that even though he could not see it God was behind the scenes working things out that Job had no idea about. 
e. In the same way God is encouraging you to remain under the pressure when you don‚Äôt understand why you are experiencing pain and what God is doing behind the scenes. 

Encourage you to study this passage on your own time or look up other scriptures that will encourage you as you wait on God.

title: How to Handle Discontentment
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
What do you do when you are discontent with where you are and you‚Äôre trusting God to promote you to where you want to be? 

Hey what‚Äôs up everyone, welcome back my name is Allen Parr and today we are talking about how to be the type of person that God wants to promote. So I want to give you 3 qualities that I believe that Bible teaches that God is looking for and the first is to‚Ä¶

1. Be Present ‚Äì Resist the temptation to see where you are now as simply a stepping stone to get to where you think you want to be. 
a. In Genesis 39 a man named Joseph finds himself working as a slave out of all positions but yet there is a word that is repeated throughout the chapter which is that despite being a slave God gave him success. In other words, he ‚Äúbloomed right where he was planted.‚Äù 
b. The tendency is to think that because where you are right now is not where you want to be that you can coast and then turn it on later. But God says, ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not faithful in the small things it‚Äôs unlikely that you‚Äôll be faithful in the big things.‚Äù 
c. Resist the temptation to see where you are now as simply a stepping stone to the next thing in your life because if you do you will often times miss the lesson that God may God want to teach you in the current season you are in. And that lesson may be the very lesson you need to be successful in your next assignment. For this season God has strategically placed you where you are and He can give you success right there. 
2. Be Positive ‚Äì One of the reasons why God never promoted the nation of Israel to the Promised Land was because of their complaining.  When you find yourself in a position that you feel for whatever reason you shouldn‚Äôt be in the tendency is to complain to whoever will listen. Here are 4 reasons why you should limit complaining. 
a. Sin ‚Äì 1 Thess. 2:14
b. People don‚Äôt want to hear it because they have their own problems
c. It‚Äôs contagious
d. It gets around and often times it gets back to your superior which is the worst thing they can hear about you.
So when you are frustrated & discontent in the position you are in resist the temptation to complain. Stay positive and keep a good attitude. 
3. Be excellent ‚Äì Col. 3:23 says, ‚Äúwhatever you do, work at it with ALL YOUR HEART.‚Äù When you‚Äôre in a position that you feel is less than ideal the tendency is to do a mediocre job because you lack the passion for it. Often times the bad habits you develop in this season follow you to the next one. 
a. Now how do you do this? You do it by Shifting your focus ‚Äì The Bible says, ‚Äúwhatever you do, work at it with ALL YOUR HEART, as WORKING FOR THE LORD, not for human masters.‚Äù
b. Be dependable ‚Äì Jesus said, ‚ÄúLet your ‚ÄòYES‚Äô be ‚ÄòYES‚Äô and your ‚ÄòNO‚Äô be ‚ÄòNO‚Äô‚Äù In other words, be the type of person that people can depend on. Develop the reputation of being a person of your word. When you commit to something your teammates can be confident that it will get done on time and with excellence.  
4. Be Submissive ‚Äì Resist the urge to take over
a. Start thinking that you can do it better
b. The key here is to remember that as long as you are in this position your function is to make your superior look better which means you can support with a smile even when you don‚Äôt agree with the decisions that are being made. 
c. Joshua/Moses, Elisha/Elijah, Timothy/Paul ‚Äì God uses and promotes submitted people.

These are the attitudes that I believe God is looking for. Essentially He says, ‚ÄúHe who is faithful in the SMALL (small font) things will also be faithful in the BIG (big font) things.‚Äù 
So, be POSITIVE, be EXCELLENT and be PRESENT and trust God to promote you to the next assignment He has planned for you in His timing.

title: Why Do We Have Four Gospels?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Have you ever wondered why there were 4 gospels written instead of just one? Stick around and find out why. 

Hey everyone, welcome back my name is Allen Parr and today we are answering the question, ‚ÄúWhy do we have 4 gospels instead of just one?‚Äù 

The first thing we have to realize is that each gospel was written by a different person for a difference purpose to a specific group of people. 

During the time when these Gospels were written there was all sorts of information circulating around written about Jesus. There were healings, miracles, sermons, teachings, parables. Stories about His life, etc. 

Each gospel writer carefully selected from this group to convince their particular audience that Jesus was indeed God. 
So let's look at Matthew

PURPOSE: To convince the Jewish people that Jesus was the promised Messiah whom THEY had just crucified.

How does he do it? Knowing that the Jews believed in the authority of the OT, Matthew used more OT Scriptures than the other writers to show how Jesus was the fulfillment of over 330 prophecies written about Him in the OT. 
ii. Focuses more on how Jesus was the fulfillment of over 330 prophecies written about Him in the OT. 
5. Mark
a. PURPOSE: To convince the Romans that Jesus was the promised Messiah. So Mark had to get into the mind of a Roman and ask, ‚ÄúWhat is it that would convince me to believe that Jesus is indeed God?‚Äù 
b. How does he do it?
i. His gospel is the shortest because he omitted things about Jesus‚Äô life that would probably not convince a Roman to believe in Jesus.
ii. If you‚Äôre a Roman you don‚Äôt care where Jesus was born and who His great, great granddaddy is? Just tell me what He can do for ME!
1. Genealogy & Nativity
2. Jesus‚Äô long teachings
3. Omits most OT references
iii. Mark knew that a Roman would be impressed with a God who performed miracles, healings and raised people from the dead. So Mark focused moreso on what Jesus did rather than what Jesus said.  
6. Luke ‚Äì Luke was a Gentile (non-Jew) who was writing primarily to a Gentile audience. When Jesus was alive there were all these groups that the Jews considered to be rejects (lepers, prostitutes, Samaritans, Gentiles, Tax Collectors, sinners, etc.) So, Luke says, you know what, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to write a gospel that will show people that Jesus didn‚Äôt just come for the good people, the religious people, the highly aristocratic Jew.‚Äù No, Jesus came for people like you and I who messed up our lives, made poor decisions, etc. And so Luke wrote to convince these people that Jesus came for them. 
a. Luke includes stories in his gospel that are not found in any of the other 3 gospels to prove that Jesus came not just for the religious Jewish people but for people who messed up their life. (Prodigal Son, Thief on the cross, prostitute, ten lepers, etc.) 
b. So next time you read Luke I want you to notice how Luke wrote to convince people that if you‚Äôve messed up your life, if you need grace or you feel like you‚Äôve made too many mistakes, Luke writes a gospel focused on grace! 
7. John ‚Äì John‚Äôs gospel is unique in that 93% of its content is not found in the other three gospels. John was writing to a general audience and his purpose was to prove that Jesus was God. He did this by focusing on 7 statements that Jesus made about Himself and 8 miracles that Jesus performed during His earthly ministry in hopes of convincing his audience that Jesus is indeed God.

title: Are Christians Still Required to Tithe?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Is the OT tithe still required for the NT Christian? 

INTRODUCTION:
FACT #1 ‚Äì Jesus never taught on tithing even though the subject He taught on more than any other was money. 
FACT #2 ‚Äì No percentages are given in NT for giving
FACT #3 ‚Äì Jesus‚Äô teachings is ALWAYS to go beyond what the law required (lust, love, murder, etc.) (see also, ‚Äúunless your righteousness exceeds‚Ä¶‚Äù

So, what does the NT teach about giving? 

There are a lot of questions surrounding the question, ‚ÄúShould Christians tithe.‚Äù 
1. Don‚Äôt limit yourself to 10% ‚Äì 2 Cor. 9:6
a. Paul introduces us to the simple law of sowing and reaping
b. God is saying, ‚ÄúI want to bless you far beyond where you think I want to but because you don‚Äôt trust you me give reluctantly.‚Äù 
c. God wants you to grow ‚Äì so that just as you are growing in other areas you are growing in your giving as well (make a goal to give one more percentage a year). 
d. God doesn‚Äôt promise that His blessings to you will be financial. He just promises that He will bless you according to what you give. 
e. God says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm giving you a blank check where you determine how much you‚Äôll be blessed.‚Äù 

2. Attitude is more important than the Amount ‚Äì 2 Cor. 9:7
a. Personal not prescribed ‚Äì If you want to give 10% then that‚Äôs great. 
b. Don‚Äôt give because you are afraid if you don‚Äôt God will punish you. This passage doesn‚Äôt say God will punish you. Rather, it says that the more you give the more God will bless you in return (the law of sowing and reaping).  
c. Reluctantly ‚Äì In other words if you are giving a certain percentage because you‚Äôve been taught or pressured to give it but you‚Äôre giving it RELUCTANTLY, God says 
d. Don‚Äôt give because you were made to feel guilty by a church leader if you didn‚Äôt give. 
e. Don‚Äôt give because you think it will cover up something bad you did. 
f. When God decides to bless you He is looking at the condition of your heart not your checkbook. 
g. 
3. Giving should be an sacrificial act of faith
a. 2 Cor. 8:1-2 ‚Äì Paul is speaking here of one of the poorest churches that gave liberally in the midst of a severe trial. 
b. The point here is that even in times of lack we can still be liberal because giving is a sacrifice. David said, ‚ÄúI will not give to the Lord that which costs me NOTHING.‚Äù
c. In the next chapter Paul reminds us that we can give trusting that He is‚Ä¶

SUMMARY
So I want to challenge you today not to limit yourself to a 10% blessing, secondly to focus more on your attitude when you give and to give sacrificially even when it hurts trusting that God can bring that and more back to you.

title: What Happens to People who have Never Heard the Gospel?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
What happens to people who have never heard of Jesus Christ? 

In order to answer this question I want to separate humanity into 3 groups. The first is the largest group and that is‚Ä¶
1. Those who HAVE heard of Christ ‚Äì (Heb. 4:12; John 14:6); Jn. 12:48; Mt. 10:33 ‚Äì Concerning this group Jesus said, "There is a judge for those who reject me and do not accept my words. My very words will condemn them at the last day." Also elsewhere He says, "If you deny me before men I will deny you before my Father in heaven." (Mt. 10:33; Jn. 12:48). These are going to be the group of people that are going to be punished the most. The emphasis here seems to be on the conscious choice to REJECT Christ and persist in disbelief. And so from these verses and others it is very clear here from these verses that people who make the conscious choice to reject Christ will spend eternity apart from Christ.  

2. Those who have NOT heard of Christ
a. Creation ‚Äì Rom. 1:20
b. Conscience ‚Äì Rom. 2:15
c. In other words, because God is fair He judges humanity according to the light they have been given which explains why there are different degrees of punishment in hell. 
d. Paul is saying that within every human being lies a conscience. We are created with it. And only God knows how much or how little a person violates their conscience.
e. Because of this God is going to judge mankind based on how they responded to the light they have been given and the sins they‚Äôve committed (Rev. 20:12).  
f. For this reason the Bible teaches that there are different levels of punishment in hell (Luke 12:47)

3. Those UNABLE to hear of Christ
a. Babies, mentally ill, etc. ‚Äì It seems logical to believe that God would be compassionate towards a group of people who were not exposed to creation, did not violate their conscience and were not introduced to Christ because this group is unable to make the decision to reject Christ. 

No one deserves to go to heaven and if God so chooses to allow some to enter that‚Äôs His decision. ILLUSTRATION: Dollar bill: For example if I choose to give this $10 bill to one person and not the other I‚Äôm not wrong for doing so because it belongs to me AND I don‚Äôt have to give it to anyone in the first place. 

CONCLUSION: I encourage you not to be too dogmatic on this issue or any issue for that matter that the Bible does not CLEARLY speak about. Instead do your part to make sure as many people as possible have heard about Christ. 

If this video has blessed you in any way I do want to encourage you share it with someone. Also if you're watching this on YouTube and you haven't done so already please hit that subscribe button. Finally, I'd love to hear your thoughts on this issue so please leave them in the comments section below. Thank you so much for watching and I'll see you next time on the BEAT.

title: How to Manage Your Stress
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
We live in a time that everyone is overwhelmed, burned-out, and STRESSED OUT! So how do you manage stress‚Ä¶‚Ä¶That‚Äôs our topic today on the Beat!

Hey Everybody, My name is Allen, Today I‚ÄôVE GOT 4 PRACTICAL TIPS ON HOW TO SUCCESSFULLY MANAGE STRESS. AND THE FIRST IS‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

1. Master the power of NO or Not Now ‚Äì (it‚Äôs not a sin to say NO‚Ä¶some of us need to get that revelation quick!) (JUST SAY NO).

A major reason why we often feel overwhelmed and stressed is because we struggle saying NO to people. In John 11 ‚Äì A woman named Mary comes to Jesus and says, ‚ÄúJesus, my brother, your boy Lazarus is about to die! We need you RIGHT NOW!‚Äù To which the Scripture says, ‚ÄúSo when He heard that Lazarus was sick, he stayed where he was two more days.‚Äù 

Notice that what was an emergency for Mary did not have to become an emergency for Jesus. (EVERYONE‚ÄôS EMERGENCIES DON‚ÄôT NEED TO BE YOURS). Often times we allow other people‚Äôs deadlines to dictate our schedules and we struggle to say NO or NOT now because we are often driven by our intense desire to gain the approval of people. 
 
2. Be clear on your Purpose and Priorities ‚Äì Mk. 1:35-39

When you‚Äôre not clear on your purpose, what ends up happening is that you get pulled in 100 different directions, none of which are related to your purpose or your priorities. 

In Mark 1, Jesus is healing people and casting out demons left and right. And one morning he sneaks away to pray and his disciples find Him and say, ‚ÄúEveryone is looking for you‚Äù (in other words, they wanted Jesus to heal them). To which Jesus essentially said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not here just to heal people I‚Äôm here to preach the word of God‚Äù and they went to another town. (Jesus performed miracles often times to get people to pay attention to His message)

Jesus was clear that His primary purpose was to preach. The more you know your specific purpose the more your life can be focused in one direction. 

ACTION STEP: Make a list of your top 3 priorities and then assess how much of your life is spent accomplishing your top 3. If it‚Äôs not much then you will quickly experience burnout, you‚Äôll feel out of control, which naturally creates stress. 
 
3. Identify your help ‚Äì Mt. 14:13-21 

One of the MAJOR reasons why many of us are so stressed out/burned out is because we don‚Äôt tap into the help that we have around us. In Matthew 14 the disciples are like, ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs too many to feed we need to send them away.‚Äù And Instead of Jesus trying to feed over 5000 people Himself (even though we know He could have) Jesus says, ‚Äú(Don‚Äôt send them away‚Ä¶YOU all feed them.‚Äù) 

Our natural instinct at times is to start feeding 5000 instead of looking at ways other people can help us feed 5000. (because we don‚Äôt trust people to do it as well as us) And as a result we end up not doing much of it very well.

ACTION STEP: Identify the people God has placed around you that can lighten your load; educate them, equip them and then empower them. Train them and then trust them to do it.

4.Schedule your REST ‚Äì Mark 6:3
(have you ever been so busy you‚Äôve not even had enough time to eat?) Jesus and His disciples were so busy that at times they didn‚Äôt even have time to EAT! And so Jesus‚Äô solution for this is not to grab a red bull, man up and keep it moving. Instead He says to come away WITH ME and rest. You need to be INTENTIONAL about setting aside specific times each week designed for you to rest, relax and recharge. When we consistently fail to have these times we feel depleted, overwhelmed and burned out. Put them on your calendar because if not these times will get replaced with other conflicting activities. If you don‚Äôt you will always be giving out and not experiencing a recharge which leaves you feeling depleted, overwhelmed and stressed. 

I want to encourage you to apply the 30-day principle ‚Äì If it‚Äôs not going to matter 30 days from now then it‚Äôs not worth stressing about today. 

If this video has helped you in any way please feel free to share it with a friend. Also, if you're watching this on YouTube and you haven't already done so please hit that subscribe button. Thank you so much for watching and I'll see you next time on the B.E.A.T.

title: Can a Christian Lose their Salvation?
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Can a Christian lose their salvation? In other words, once saved are you saved NO MATTER WHAT‚Ä¶YOU‚Ä¶DO?

Hey what‚Äôs up everybody? My name is Allen Parr and today we‚Äôre asking and answering the question, ‚ÄúCan a Christian lose their salvation?‚Äù Now on the surface this may appear to be nothing more than an interesting theological debate, but it actually has very practical implications that can affect the way you live your life on a daily basis. 

On one hand people tend to go to the extreme which is called license. And license says, ‚ÄúI have the license (freedom) to do whatever I want to do. I can live like a heathen because I can‚Äôt lose my salvation anyway.‚Äù The other extreme is called legalism. And legalism says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure if my salvation is really secure, if I can lose it tomorrow or maybe I‚Äôve already lost it.  So I must work; I must do certain things every day to earn God‚Äôs favor and earn His forgiveness. 

So I want to give you 3 reasons why I personally believe that once we are saved we are ALWAYS saved. 

1. Our Salvation is ETERNAL - Eternity Past ‚Äì Eph. 1:4 ‚Äì This scripture clearly says that before God even formed the world He chose us to be saved. In other words God looked down and saw every mistake you and I were going to make past, present and future and yet He still chose us. So when we say a Christian can lose their salvation what we are saying is that I can do something so bad that is going to catch God off guard to where now God is going to change His mind which implies that God did not know beforehand that I was going to do it. 

2. Our Salvation is not based on WORKS ‚Äì Eph. 2:8-10 ‚Äì So whenever we say a Christian can lose their salvation what we‚Äôre saying but we don‚Äôt realize that we‚Äôre saying it is, ‚ÄúJesus whatever you did on the cross wasn‚Äôt sufficient. It wasn‚Äôt good enough. It was good enough to cover some of my sins but not all of them. So what I must do is take what you did on the cross which wasn‚Äôt good enough to cover ALL of my sins and add it to my good works (church going, tithing, abstinence, good deeds, etc.) (CROSS + LIST OF WORKS = SALVATION) and if I obey enough, give enough, serve enough, resist my sinful urges enough then between what I do and what you did I‚Äôll get into heaven. The Bible says our salvation is a GIFT which means it‚Äôs FREE! We did NOTHING to earn it therefore there is nothing we can do to lose it. Why? Because if it were by WORKS that we were saved then when we get to heaven we could boast and say that we got there because of something we did. 

3. Our Salvation is secure because of God‚Äôs POWER
a. John 6:39 says, ‚ÄúAnd this is the will of God, that I should not lose even one of all those he has given me, but that I should raise them up at the last day.‚Äù
b. John 10:28-29 ‚Äì These verses indicate that if God has enough power to save someone He has more than enough power to keep them saved and to preserve them. 
c. Love ‚Äì Rom. 8:38 ‚Äì When we say a person can lose their salvation what we are saying is that God‚Äôs love is like ours. It‚Äôs conditional. It‚Äôs conditioned upon what we do. And that reduces God‚Äôs love from being unconditional to human love which is conditional.

(There‚Äôs nothing in the Bible that clearly states at what time you lose your salvation or what you have to do in order to lose it.)

So, can you lose your salvation? I believe for these 3 reasons and many others I would argue that the Bible teaches that a Christian cannot lose their salvation. 

The biggest argument is‚Ä¶

(Instead of using eternal security as a license to sin and take advantage of God‚Äôs grace, instead use it as motivation to praise and serve God more because God didn‚Äôt have to choose you but He did in His grace and mercy.)

Now this is a VERY controversial subject and one that I would LOVE to hear your thoughts on so please drop me a comment below either on YouTube or Facebook and let‚Äôs talk about it.

title: HOW TO CONTROL YOUR MOUTH!
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
HOOK: This hole and this little red thing inside this hole gets us in more trouble than any other part of our body. So, how do we control it? That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre gonna talk about today. 

INTRODUCTION:
Hey what‚Äôs up everyone welcome back to the BEAT. Today we are talking about how to control our mouth (the same advice goes for our communication on Facebook too). And in James 3 the Bible gives us some very practical advice on how to tame our tongue. 

#1 ‚Äì Be AWARE of the PITFALLS
James says we ALL stumble in MANY ways and ANYONE who says they are not at fault is PERFECT. The reason why we ALL struggle with our mouth is because there are so many different ways we can sin with our tongue.

Slander, gossip, lie, complaining, critical spirit, cursing, exaggerate, discourage, curse, not following through, dirty jokes, outbursts of anger (aka ‚Äúgo off on folk‚Äù), half-truths, sarcasm, boasting, complaining, etc.

And so James says because there are so many ways we can STUMBLE we should be mindful of how our mouths can be used to tear someone down.   

#2 ‚Äì Be INTENTIONAL and Speak positivity ‚Äì Notice here by using the illustration of a horse to illustrate how something small can a very to make a HUGE positive impact.  

One of the reasons why this is so critical is because when you praise and encourage people you earn the right to correct them when they are wrong. TRUTH is best received when TIME is invested and TRUST is established and one of the ways of doing this is to be known as an encourager; someone who makes small deposits into people‚Äôs lives over time by encouraging them, complimenting them, offering constructive criticism designed to make them a better person and add value to them. And so for many of us because it‚Äôs not our nature we need to be INTENTIONAL about speaking LIFE into other people‚Äôs lives. 


#3 ‚Äì Be CAUTIOUS and THINK before you SPEAK ‚Äì James says, ‚Äúconsider‚Äù or ‚Äúthink about‚Äù the fire you could start simply by not filtering what comes in your mind so that it doesn‚Äôt come out of your mouth. (Some people have no filter between their mind and their mouth.) I want to encourage you to use this acronym on a daily basis (maybe even a minute by minute basis depending on how bad it is) before you prepare to blast this person with venom. This acronym alone will help many of your relationships thrive. 
T ‚Äì Is it TRUE?
H ‚Äì Is it HELPFUL?
I ‚Äì Is it INSPIRING
N ‚Äì Is it NECESSARY?
K ‚Äì Is it KIND? 

Just this acronym alone will save us a world of trouble in our relationships. 

#4 ‚Äì BE GENTLE and Check your Tone ‚Äì v. 6 ‚Äì James says here our tongue has the power to ‚Äústain the whole body‚Äù (ESV) ‚Äì Wedding dress Illustration: Many of us have really good things to say but it‚Äôs never received by others because what we‚Äôre saying is not packaged right. People will hardly notice the dress because their focus will be on the stain. Prov. 15:1 ‚Äì ‚ÄúA soft answer turns away wrath but a harsh word stirs up anger.‚Äù Our presentation immediately turns people off so that people don‚Äôt receive what we‚Äôre saying.

title: Christians and Pornography | 4 Reasons Christians Should Not Watch Porn
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Visit my website at www.allenparr.com
Connect with me on facebook at www.facebook.com/allenparr
Follow me on twitter at www.twitter.com/allengparr
Subscribe today at www.youtube.com/thebeatagp

Christians and pornography? The two should not go together. This video provides 4 reasons why Christians should not watch pornography. 

What‚Äôs the big deal about watching a little porn every once in a while? 

The world will say, ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs nothing wrong with it. You‚Äôre not hurting anybody. It‚Äôs better than committing adultery or fornication.‚Äù But today I want to share with you what I believe are 4 problems associated with watching porn and the first is what I‚Äôm calling the‚Ä¶

#1 ‚Äì The Inverse Effect ‚Äì The inverse effect says, ‚ÄúThe more I look at porn the less our desire will be for my spouse.‚Äù This one you can take to the BANK! 
‚Ä¢ For example, if you‚Äôre married without even thinking about it, you will subconsciously compare your spouse to a world of fantasies and because your spouse may not be able to replicate your fantasy created through watching porn then over time your desire for them will decrease. 
‚Ä¢ Why does this happen? (It‚Äôs because SATAN TEMPTS US WITH SEXUAL BOREDOM!) Our human nature is naturally attracted to that which is new. And every time we watch porn there is the possibility of being exposed to newness, novelty and variety which could be the antithesis of what you‚Äôre experiencing with your spouse which ultimately causes your desire for them to go down.

The second major problem with pornography is that it creates insecurities. 

#2 ‚Äì Creates insecurities ‚Äì Watching porn can create insecurities both within yourself and in your spouse. 
‚Ä¢ If you‚Äôre watching pornography you will subconsciously begin to compare yourself with the people you see on the screen leading you to believe that if I don‚Äôt look this way, if I don‚Äôt sound this way, if I don‚Äôt perform this way then I may not be satisfying to my spouse leading you to feel insecure with how God created you. 
‚Ä¢ On the flip side if your spouse knows you are watching pornography, it can cause them to feel like they have to measure up and compete with all the fantasies you are creating in your mind which isn‚Äôt fair to them because they are being compared to something that not‚Äôs reality. 

The third problem with watching porn is that it‚Ä¶
#3 ‚Äì Hinders your spiritual life ‚Äì Watching pornography is conducive to living in shame and secrecy which is exactly the place where the enemy wants you to be. He wants you to be secretive, embarrassed, ashamed so that you don‚Äôt feel comfortable sharing with other people the things that are going on in your life. Not only that, but we can sometimes feel too ashamed to even come to God because we feel dirty (Prov. 28:13). We feel unworthy to pray to God; unworthy to read our Bibles; we feel unworthy to get our prayers answered; we sometimes don‚Äôt feel worthy to come to church and we stay away from community because we think if people only knew what I‚Äôm dealing with they wouldn‚Äôt accept us. For the Christian who is being convicted by the Holy Spirit it hinders us from creating that intimacy with God that we so desire.  

The fourth problem with watching pornography is that it‚Ä¶
#4 ‚Äì Is an insatiable desire ‚Äì One of the biggest problems with pornography is that it can lead to other forms of sexual sin. In other words it‚Äôs only a matter of time before we get bored with the fantasy and want to make our fantasy a reality which means it can lead to 
a. Fornication, adultery (married), maybe even swinging, coveting someone else‚Äôs spouse.
b. (Now you tell me‚Ä¶if you‚Äôre thinking about this (arrow) all day aren‚Äôt you going to want  to eat one sooner or later?) 
One of the major problems with pornography is that it invites you, it entices you to think that, ‚ÄúOh if I just watch a little bit of porn I‚Äôll be okay or I just need a little bit more to get by‚Äù deceiving you into thinking that it provides relief, when in actuality it slowly enslaves you to the point where before you know it, the more you do it the more you want to do it. 

Now I know this is a sensitive subject and in this video I surfaced the problem but stay tuned for my blog this Friday where I provide practical next steps we can take to attack this issue of pornography. Thanks, share, subscribe‚Ä¶

title: How to Pray for Others
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Have you ever run out of things to pray for when someone asks you to pray for them? In this video I provide 10 things that every person needs prayer for. 

How do you pray for someone who just says, ‚ÄúI need you to pray for me.‚Äù Today I want to introduce you to the BEST prayer that you could ever pray for anyone, at any time in any situation, no matter what. 

In the NT book of Colossians 1 Paul prays this beautiful prayer for the church and you can use this same prayer as you pray for other people and I want to break this down into three categories. First of all you are praying for‚Ä¶

1. Wisdom
a. SCRIPTURE: ‚ÄúWe continually ask God to fill you with the knowledge of His will through all the wisdom and understanding the Spirit gives.‚Äù So here you are praying that this person views life through the same lens that God views it and filters every decision through the wisdom found in the word of God. 
i. Family ‚Äì lead their families in a way that would honor God
ii. Finances ‚Äì Make good decisions, good stewards, generous
iii. Friendships ‚Äì Choose the right relationships, and have wisdom to know when to sever the wrong relationships
b. And so here you are praying that they would apply the WISDOM found in the word of God and that they would know very clearly what God‚Äôs WILL is for their life. 
c. Intellectual and Experiential
2. Walk
a. Paul says here I‚Äôm praying ‚Äú‚Ä¶that you may live a life worthy of the Lord and please Him in every way‚Ä¶‚Äù
b. So here you‚Äôre praying that a person‚Äôs 
i. CONDUCT (how they LIVE)
ii. CONVERSATION (how they TALK)
iii. CHARACTER (integrity) ‚Äì be CONSISTENT with how Jesus lived His life. So you‚Äôre praying that there be no hypocrisy in their life. Here you‚Äôre praying that their private life match up with their public life. 
c. How do you do that? Paul says by ‚Äúincreasing in the knowledge of God.‚Äù As we grow in our knowledge of God our CONDUCT, our CONVERSATION and our CHARACTER changes because now we are being CONVICTED by the word of God. 
d. You‚Äôre praying that they would live their lives in such a way where others can emulate them and follow in their example.  
e. SCRIPTURE: ‚Äú‚Ä¶bearing fruit in every good work‚Ä¶‚Äù
3. Weaknesses
a. SCRIPTURE: ‚Äú‚Ä¶being strengthened in all power‚Ä¶‚Äù
i. Physical weaknesses ‚Äì physical illness, 
ii. Emotional weaknesses (depression, anger, discouragement, loss of hope, low self-image)
iii. Spiritual weaknesses (temptation, if they are feeling and experiencing temptation in a given area where they feel weak and are prone to yield you pray for God‚Äôs power to strengthen them. 
b. And to be even more specific you can pray that‚Ä¶‚Äú‚Ä¶may have great endurance and patience‚Ä¶‚Äù
i. Difficulty ‚Äì Loss of a loved one, divorce, broken relationship, financial stress, loss of a job, wayward child, etc. 
ii. Hardship
iii. Trial
c. Endurance ‚Äì Greek word
d. God whatever trials they are facing right now I pray you give them the ability to endure and to remain steadfast up under the pressure of the situation. 

So, I want to encourage you today to go out and pray this simple but effective prayer over the lives of your children, your spouse, your loved ones even your enemies. Make it a part of your daily prayer to pray that they would use WISDOM but not just any wisdom but WISDOM found in the word of God and that they would know God‚Äôs perfect will for their life. Second, pray for their walk (integrity, etc.). And finally pray for their weaknesses. We all have them and we all need prayer.

title: How To Get Answers To Your Prayers
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Do you want to see more of your prayers being answered? Are you tired of praying and not seeing any results? Today I want to share with you how you can pray more effectively. 

Okay so today I want to share with you 3 practical ways you can improve your prayer life and hopefully see more answers to prayer (that‚Äôs what we all want right?)

1. Pray with a PURE HEART ‚Äì There are at least 5 reasons that the Bible teaches you can pray as hard as you can and God won‚Äôt answer your prayers. 
a. Marital conflict ‚Äì 1 Pet. 3:7 ‚Äì God is like, ‚Äúif you‚Äôre not treating your spouse right don‚Äôt come asking me for anything.‚Äù
b. You‚Äôve offended someone ‚Äì Matt. 5:23-24 - So if you‚Äôve offended someone and you haven‚Äôt sought that person‚Äôs forgiveness then God says don‚Äôt come asking me for anything. 
c. Unforgiveness ‚Äì Matt. 6:14-15 ‚Äì Also if you‚Äôre unwilling to forgive others God won‚Äôt answer your prayers because you‚Äôre not willing to do the very thing that opens up the door for you to even pray to God.
d. Unconfessed sin ‚Äì Ps. 66:18 ‚Äì Also if you have any known sin in your life you should ALWAYS confess it before asking God for anything.
e. Wrong motives ‚Äì Jam. 4:3 ‚Äì You‚Äôre asking God for something but it‚Äôs really a selfish motivation God may not answer that prayer.  
f. So make sure to check the condition of your heart before you ever ask God for anything.  
2. Pray Persistently ‚Äì Now this is where many of us fail. Do you know why many of our prayers aren‚Äôt being answered? It‚Äôs because we don‚Äôt PERSIST in prayer. We pray one or two times and then when God doesn‚Äôt answer we give up. But notice that even Jesus encourages us to pray repeatedly. 
a. Matt. 7:7 ‚Äì He said, ‚ÄúThe Bible says, ‚Äúask, seek, knock.‚Äù When you go to someone‚Äôs house you don‚Äôt knock one time and expect them to open the door. You keep on knocking until they open the door. Why because you know they are home. In the same way, God is inviting us to keep on knocking on heaven‚Äôs door until it opens or until God clearly shows you that it is not His will for your life.   
b. You may ask, ‚Äúwhy won‚Äôt God just give me what I want the first time?‚Äù It‚Äôs because persistent, repeated prayer demonstrates that we truly believe in our heart that the God we are praying to has the ability to bring to pass that which we are praying for.  And faith always pleases the heart of God. Maybe God is waiting for you to continue to persist in prayer before He answers your request.
c. Luke 18  
d. ENDING QUESTION: What prayer have you given up on praying for because God hasn‚Äôt answered it in your timetable? I encourage you to persist in prayer until you get a clear answer from God no matter how long it takes. 
3. Pray Precisely/Specifically ‚Äì Have you ever noticed how many of our prayers are basic? I‚Äôm reminded of the story in Mark 10 where a blind man is crying our repeatedly, ‚ÄúJesus have mercy on me‚Äù (persistent but not specific) so much so that the people around him told him to shut up. Finally, Jesus invited him to come to him and asked him, ‚ÄúWHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO FOR YOU?‚Äù And the man said, ‚ÄúI want to see.‚Äù And he received his sight. The point is not that the man was healed but rather that Jesus is INVITING us to be more specific with our requests.  It forces you to really think about what it is you are trusting God for. HOW WILL YOU KNOW YOUR PRAYER IS ANSWERED IF IT‚ÄôS NOT SPECIFIC? If God were to pose this question to you, how would you answer?

So if your prayer life has gotten a little stale, I want to encourage you starting today that when you pray to make sure that first of all your heart is pure before God, secondly no matter how tired you get to persist in prayer and finally, don‚Äôt be afraid to ask God specifically for what you want. God in His word is inviting us to pray this way.

title: How to Resist Temptation as a Christian
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Are you feeling strongly tempted? This video provide 3 helpful tips on how to handle temptation. 

www.facebook.com/allenparr - Facebook
www.twitter.com/allengparr - Twitter
www.allenparr.com - Ministry Website
www.youtube.com/thebeatagp - YouTube channel

What do you do when you are being strongly tempted and everything in you wants to just give into the temptation? 

Okay so temptation is a part of our every day life and there is no sense in praying for it to go away. So in this video I want to give you 3 strategies for how to handle temptation. 

#1 ‚Äì Anticipate the TEMPTATION ‚Äì Prov. 27:12
‚ÄúA wise person foresees danger and takes precautions. The simple go on blindly and suffer the consequences.‚Äù
In other words if you‚Äôre waiting until you are tempted to decide how you‚Äôre going to respond often times that‚Äôs too late. There are certain seasons in our lives when we can EXPECT to experience high levels of temptation. For example when you‚Äôre‚Ä¶

‚Ä¢ Hungry (attention, physical touch, affirmation, etc.) ‚Äì Esau ‚Äì Gen. 25:34 - When there is something in your life that you strongly crave but you can‚Äôt have you‚Äôre going to be strongly tempted. 
‚Ä¢ Angry ‚Äì Numbers 20
‚Ä¢ Lonely ‚Äì David - 2 Sam. 11:1-5
‚Ä¢ Tired ‚Äì Elijah - 1 Sam. 19

These are seasons when we need to HALT. We need to slow down and get some people around us to make sure that we don‚Äôt do anything foolish! 

Second of all if it‚Äôs an area that you feel like you are one bad decision away from giving in to an area that you feel extremely weak in I want to encourage you to take some time to‚Ä¶

#2 ‚Äì Ask yourself some very HARD QUESTIONS 

‚Ä¢ How is this going to hurt me? Financial, career, business, reputation, ministry, spiritual life, ability to share my faith with others are who waiting for me to prove to them that my faith is not real, etc. 
‚Ä¢ How is this going to hurt the people I love the most? How are the people who look up to me the most going to see me not if, but when I‚Äôm exposed? This could be your children, people you are mentoring, people at your job, etc.  
‚Ä¢ How will I feel about this tomorrow? We know how you feel about it right now but‚Ä¶will I regret this tomorrow? 

So, my third and final point is to‚Ä¶
#3 ‚Äì Stop playing around with TEMPTATION ‚Äì One of the main reasons why many of us continue to fall into temptation is because we think we can leave it hanging around and our willpower is strong enough to resist. (late night Facebook chat, ‚Äúinnocent‚Äù lunch with co-worker you think is fine, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Jesus said, ‚ÄúIf your right hand is causing you to sin then cut it off!‚Äù He didn‚Äôt say put your hand down. In other words, He was suggesting for us to take radical action. In order to win the battle over temptation you may need to take some radical steps. Because the more we entertain the temptation the more comfortable we get with ignoring that voice inside that is telling us to stop. 
‚Ä¢ Delete phone numbers
‚Ä¢ QUESTION: What radical steps are you currently taking or are you willing to take to greatly reduce the chances of you giving in to temptation? I‚Äôm not saying to cut your hand off but how can you expect to consistently scoop fire into your lap and not get burned? (PROVERBS 6:27)
‚Ä¢ If someone paid you a million dollars would you stop? 
 
So, if for whatever reason you do fall into sin and yield to the temptation, don‚Äôt punish yourself by getting depressed about it for 3 days. Confess your sin immediately before God, accept His forgiveness, repent and and move on. 

Thanks so much for watching. The support has been great. If you‚Äôre watching this on YouTube please hit that subscribe button. Also, I‚Äôve included some other videos you can check out. Also, you can download my free eBook at my website. Thanks so much for watching and I‚Äôll see you next time.

title: How to Handle the Guilt of your Past
description:
Please watch: "The ONE Thing Every Christian Should Be Doing But Most Are NOT!" 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slK6HI8tUTY --~--
Do you struggle to accept God's forgiveness? This video provides 4 things that God would say to someone who is struggling with the guilt of their past. 

Are you struggling with guilt from your past and do you believe that God has truly forgiven you for it? Are you struggling to believe God has forgiven you because of the guilt of your past?  

What would God say to a person who is struggling with the guilt of their past? 

Okay so our story today comes from Luke 22 where Peter fails Jesus in an area that he never imagined he would. Peter was the most outspoken of all 12 of the disciples and yet when given the opportunity to take a stand for Jesus he denied that he ever even knew Jesus. And the Bible says that at that very moment their eyes locked and Peter felt so horrible that he began to weep bitterly because he knew he had failed. 

What would God say to someone like Peter? 

1. God specializes in using people who have failed
a. Abraham ‚Äì Liar ‚Äì Father of the Jewish Nation
b. Moses ‚Äì Murdered a man ‚Äì Led 2 million Jews free from Egyptian slavery
c. Rahab ‚Äì Prostitute ‚Äì She was in the lineage of people that gave birth to Jesus.
d. David ‚Äì Adulterer/murderer ‚Äì Greatest king of Israel
e. His son Solomon ‚Äì 700 wives - Built the first Jewish temple
f. Fast forward to the NT you have‚Ä¶Paul ‚Äì Killed Christians ‚Äì Greatest apostle who ever lived and the one whom the Holy Spirit used to write half of the NT.
g. Peter ‚Äì Denied he ever even knew Jesus
 
QUESTION: Now if God can not only forgive but use murderers, adulterers, prostitutes, polygamists, liars and cowards like Peter what could you have possibly done that would somehow disqualify you from receiving God‚Äôs forgiveness? 

And the first thing He would say would be that He specializes in using people who have made an absolute mess of their life. 

2. God already knew about your failures before you did ‚Äì Lk. 22:34
a. Notice that Jesus predicts that Peter is going to fail him.
b. God saw every mistake that you have ever made and some future ones you don‚Äôt even know about yet and in spite of that He still chose to save you. 
c. You cannot catch God off guard which is the reason why you can displease God but never disappoint Him. 

3. God would invite you to turn towards Him ‚Äì ‚ÄúSo when you have repented and turned to me‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Äì Notice that Jesus is inviting Peter to turn towards him instead of away from him. Our tendency when we fail‚Ä¶again‚Ä¶and again‚Ä¶is to turn away and lock ourselves into a prison of pity. But the best thing you can do when you are experiencing guilt is to turn towards God through prayer, journaling, worship, Bible study, small group community, etc. 

4. Use your failures as the fuel that ignites your purpose ‚Äì Lk. 22:32 ‚Äì What the enemy wants to do is to influence you to fail and then to be so ashamed of it that you don‚Äôt share your mistakes with others and as a result no one else gets the victory. Sometimes the place of our greatest failure can be the place of our greatest ministry. Every time you fail God gives you two gifts (a heart of humility and a heart of compassion). And because of that we are the most qualified to help other people who are struggling in the same ways we previously struggled in. 

SUMMARY:
I want to encourage you today to truly embrace God‚Äôs forgiveness and recognize that because you did nothing to earn it, there is absolutely nothing you can do to lose it.
